00034 ## @package pyp_metrics
00035 # pyp_metrics contains a set of procedures for calculating metrics on PyPedal
00036 # pedigree objects.  These metrics include coefficients of inbreeding and
00037 # relationship as well as effective founder number, effective population size,
00038 # and effective ancestor number.
00039 ##
00040 
00041 import copy, logging, numpy, os, pickle, random, string, sys

00043 import pyp_network
00044 import pyp_nrm
00045 import pyp_utils
00046 from numpy import random

00052     print '[INFO]: The psyco module could not be imported in pyp_metrics. Psyco speed optimizations are not available.'

00054 ##
00055 # min_max_f() takes a pedigree and returns a list of the individuals with the n
00056 # largest and n smallest coefficients of inbreeding.  Individuals with CoI of
00057 # zero are not included.
00058 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
00059 # @param a A numerator relationship matrix (optional).
00060 # @param n An integer (optional, default is 10).
00061 # @param forma If A must be formed should dense or sparse matrices be used?
00062 # @retval Lists of the individuals with the n largest and the  n smallest CoI in the pedigree as (ID, CoI) tuples.
00063 def min_max_f(pedobj, a='', n=10, forma='dense'):
00064     """
00065     Given a pedigree or relationship matrix, return a list of the
00066     individuals with the n largest and n smallest coefficients of
00067     inbreeding; individuals with CoI of zero are not included.
00068     """
00069     try: logging.info('Entered min_max_f()')
00070     except: pass
00071     if forma not in ['dense','sparse']:
00072         format = 'dense'
00073     if not pedobj.kw['form_nrm'] and not a:
00074         #if forma == 'sparse':
00075         #    a = pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix_sparse(pedobj.pedigree,pedobj.kw)
00076         #else:
00077         #    a = pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix(pedobj.pedigree,pedobj.kw)
00078         a = pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix(pedobj.pedigree,pedobj.kw,method=forma)
00079         print a
00080         individual_coi = fast_a_coefficients(pedobj,a=a)
00081         print individual_coi
00082     else:
00083         individual_coi = fast_a_coefficients(pedobj)
00084 
00085     _mycoi = individual_coi.items()
00086     _mycoi.sort(pyp_utils.sort_dict_by_values)
00087 
00088     # If the user asks for more high-low COI than there are animals in
00089     # the pedigree with non-zero COI set the new n to approximately half of the
00090     # animals returned by fast_a_coefficients().
00091     if n > len(_mycoi):
00092         old_n = n
00093         if len(_mycoi) % 2 == 0:
00094             n = int( round( float( len(_mycoi) )/2., 0 ) )
00095         else:
00096             n = int( round( float( len(_mycoi) )/2. - 1.0, 0 ) )
00097         print '[INFO]: You asked for more high and low COI, %s, than there are animals in the pedigree with non-zero COI, %s.  n was adjusted from %s to %s.' % (old_n,len(_mycoi),old_n,n)
00098         logging.info('[INFO]: You asked for more high and low COI, %s, than there are animals in the pedigree with non-zero COI, %s.  n was adjusted from %s to %s.',old_n,len(_mycoi),old_n,n)
00099 
00100     high_coi = []
00101     low_coi = []
00102 
00103     for _i in range(n):
00104         high_coi.append(_mycoi[len(_mycoi)-_i-1])
00105         low_coi.append(_mycoi[_i])
00106 
00107     try: logging.info('Exited min_max_f()')
00108     except: pass
00109     return high_coi, low_coi

00111 ##
00112 # a_effective_founders_lacy() calculates the number of effective founders in a
00113 # pedigree using the exact method of Lacy.
00114 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
00115 # @param a A numerator relationship matrix (optional).
00116 # @retval A dictionary of results, including the effective founder number.
00117 def a_effective_founders_lacy(pedobj, a=''):
00118     """
00119     Calculate the number of effective founders in a pedigree using the exact method of Lacy.
00120     """
00121     try: logging.info('Entered a_effective_founders_lacy()')
00122     except: pass
00123     if not a:
00124         try:
00125             a = pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix(pedobj.pedigree,pedobj.kw)
00126         except:
00127             return -999.9
00128     l = len(pedobj.pedigree)
00129     mp = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']
00130     # form lists of founders and descendants
00131     out_dict = {}
00132     n_f = 0
00133     n_d = 0
00134     fs = []
00135     ds = []
00136     for i in range(l):
00137         animalid = int(pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID)
00138         #
00139         if pedobj.pedigree[i].founder == 'y' and str(animalid) != mp:
00140             n_f = n_f + 1
00141             fs.append(animalid)
00142         elif animalid != 0:
00143             n_d = n_d + 1
00144             ds.append(animalid)
00145         else:
00146             pass
00147     #print 'fs : %s' % (fs)
00148     #print 'ds : %s' % (ds)
00149     p = numpy.zeros([n_d,n_f],'d')
00150     # create a table listing relationship between founders and descendants
00151     for row in range(n_d):
00152         for col in range(n_f):
00153             p[row,col] = a[fs[col]-1,ds[row]-1]
00154     #print 'p : %s' % (p)
00155     # sum each column
00156     p_sums= []
00157     for col in range(n_f):
00158         p_sum = 0.
00159         for row in range(n_d):
00160             if p[row,col] != 0:
00161                 p_sum = p_sum + p[row,col]
00162         p_sums.append(p_sum)
00163     # weight sums by counts to get relative contributions
00164     rel_p = []
00165     rel_p_sq = []
00166     for i in range(len(p_sums)):
00167         rel_p.append(p_sums[i] / n_d)
00168         rel_p_sq.append(rel_p[i] * rel_p[i])
00169     # sum  the squared relative contributions and take the reciprocal to get f_e
00170     sum_rel_p_sq = 0.
00171     for i in range(len(rel_p_sq)):
00172         sum_rel_p_sq = sum_rel_p_sq + rel_p_sq[i]
00173     print '='*60
00174     #print 'p_sums:\t%s' % (p_sums)
00175     #print 'rel_ps:\t%s' % (rel_p)
00176     if sum_rel_p_sq == 0.:
00177         f_e = 0.
00178     else:
00179         f_e = 1. / sum_rel_p_sq
00180     if pedobj.kw['messages'] == 'verbose':
00181         print 'animals:\t%s' % (len(fs)+len(ds))
00182         print 'founders:\t%s' % (n_f)
00183         print 'descendants:\t%s' % (n_d)
00184         print 'f_e:\t\t%5.3f' % (f_e)
00185         print '='*60
00186 
00187     out_dict['fa_animal_count'] = len(fs) + len(ds)
00188     out_dict['fa_founder_count'] = n_f
00189     out_dict['fa_descendant_count'] = n_d
00190     out_dict['fa_effective_founders'] = f_e
00191 
00192     # write some output to a file for later use
00193     outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_fe_lacy_','.dat')
00194     aout = open(outputfile,'w')
00195     line = '='*60+'\n'
00196     aout.write('%s\n' % line)
00197     aout.write('%s animals\n' % l)
00198     aout.write('%s founders: %s\n' % n_f,fs)
00199     aout.write('%s descendants: %s\n' % n_d,ds)
00200     aout.write('effective number of founders: %s\n' % f_e)
00201     aout.write('%s\n' % line)
00202     aout.close()
00203 
00204     try: logging.info('Exited a_effective_founders_lacy()')
00205     except: pass
00206 
00207     return out_dict
00208 
00209 ##
00210 # effective_founders_lacy() calculates the number of effective founders in a pedigree
00211 # using the exact method of Lacy.  This version of the routine a_effective_founders_lacy()
00212 # is designed to work with larger pedigrees as it forms "familywise" relationship matrices
00213 # rather than a "populationwise" relationship matrix.
00214 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
00215 # @retval A dictionary of results, including the effective founder number.
00216 def effective_founders_lacy(pedobj):
00217     """
00218     Calculate the number of effective founders in a pedigree using the exact method of Lacy.
00219     """
00220     try: logging.info('Entered effective_founders_lacy()')
00221     except: pass
00222     caller = 'pyp_metrics.effective_founders_lacy'
00223     out_dict = {}
00224 
00225     # founder_descendants is expecting a renumbered pedigree.
00226 #     print 'pedobj.kw[\'pedigree_is_renumbered\'] = %s' % ( pedobj.kw['pedigree_is_renumbered'] )
00227     if pedobj.kw['pedigree_is_renumbered'] == 0:
00228 #         print '[NOTE]: The pedigree passed to pyp_metrics/effective_founders_lacy() is not renumbered!  Fixing...'
00229         pedobj.kw['renumber'] = 1
00230         pedobj.renumber()
00231     else:
00232 #         print '[NOTE]: The pedigree passed to pyp_metrics/effective_founders_lacy() is renumbered!'
00233         pass
00234 
00235     _f_peds = founder_descendants(pedobj)
00236     _f_contribs = {}
00237     _f_contribs_sum = 0.0
00238     _f_contribs_weighted = {}
00239     _f_contribs_weighted_sum_sq = 0.0
00240     _f_e = 0.0
00241     for f in _f_peds.keys():
00242         # Note that the "pedigrees" returned by founder_descendants are really
00243         # just dictionaries of dictionaries.  We need to form real pedigrees from
00244         # them before we can continue.
00245         #print 'Working on animal %s' % ( pedobj.idmap[f] )
00246         l = len(_f_peds[f])
00247         _r = []
00248         for _k,_v in _f_peds[f].iteritems():
00249             _r.append(copy.copy(pedobj.pedigree[int(_k)-1]))
00250         # Don't forget to add the founder to the pedigree!
00251         _r.append(copy.copy(pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.idmap[f])-1]))
00252         _tag = '%s_%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],pedobj.idmap[f])
00253         _r = pyp_utils.fast_reorder(_r,_tag)      # Reorder the pedigree
00254         _s = pyp_utils.renumber(_r,_tag)          # Renumber the pedigree
00255         _opts = copy.copy(pedobj.kw)
00256         _opts['filetag'] = _tag
00257         _a = pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix(_s,_opts)       # Form the NRM w/the tabular method
00258         #_a = pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix(_s,_tag)       # Form the NRM w/the tabular method
00259         _map = pyp_utils.load_id_map(_tag)        # Load the ID map from the renumbering
00260                                                 # procedure so that the CoIs are assigned
00261                                                 # to the correct animals.
00262         # We are going to sum over each slice to get the (unweighted) founder
00263         # contribution associated with founder f.
00264         _f_contribs[f] = _a[0,1:].sum()
00265         _f_contribs_sum = _f_contribs_sum + _f_contribs[f]
00266         # Clean up the subpedigree ID maps that we are not going to use again.
00267         pyp_utils.delete_id_map(_tag)
00268         # Empty our working dictionary and lists
00269         _a = []
00270         _s = []
00271         _r = []
00272         _map = {}
00273     for _k,_v in _f_contribs.iteritems():
00274         try:
00275             _f_contribs_weighted[_k] = _v / _f_contribs_sum
00276         except ZeroDivisionError:
00277             _f_contribs_weighted[_k] = 0.0
00278         _f_contribs_weighted_sum_sq = _f_contribs_weighted_sum_sq + ( _f_contribs_weighted[_k] ** 2 )
00279     try:
00280         _f_e = 1. / _f_contribs_weighted_sum_sq
00281     except ZeroDivisionError:
00282         _f_e = 0.0
00283 
00284     if pedobj.kw['messages'] == 'verbose':
00285         print '\tFounder contributions: %s' % (_f_contribs)
00286         print '\tProportional founder contributions: %s' % (_f_contribs_weighted)
00287         print '\tSum of founder contributions: %s' % (_f_contribs_sum)
00288         print '\tSum of squared proportional founder contributions: %s' % (_f_contribs_weighted_sum_sq)
00289         print 'Effective founder number (f_e): %s' % (_f_e)
00290 
00291     # write some output to a file for later use
00292     outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_fe_lacy','.dat')
00293     aout = open(outputfile,'w')
00294     pyp_io.pyp_file_header(aout,caller)
00295     aout.write('%s animals in pedigree\n' % (len(pedobj.pedigree)))
00296     aout.write('%s founders: %s\n' % (pedobj.metadata.num_unique_founders,pedobj.metadata.unique_founder_list))
00297     aout.write('Founder contributions: %s\n' % (_f_contribs))
00298     aout.write('Proportional founder contributions: %s\n' % (_f_contribs_weighted))
00299     aout.write('Sum of founder contributions: %s\n' % (_f_contribs_sum))
00300     aout.write('Sum of squared proportional founder contributions: %s\n' % (_f_contribs_weighted_sum_sq))
00301     aout.write('Effective founder number: %s\n' % (_f_e))
00302     pyp_io.pyp_file_footer(aout,caller)
00303     aout.close()
00304 
00305     out_dict['fa_animal_count'] = len(pedobj.pedigree)
00306     out_dict['fa_founder_count'] = pedobj.metadata.num_unique_founders
00307     out_dict['fa_descendant_count'] = len(pedobj.pedigree) - pedobj.metadata.num_unique_founders
00308     out_dict['fa_effective_founders'] = _f_e
00309 
00310     try: logging.info('Exited effective_founders_lacy()')
00311     except: pass
00312 
00313     #return _f_e
00314     return out_dict
00315 
00316 ##
00317 # a_effective_founders_boichard() uses the algorithm in Appendix A of Boichard et al.
00318 # (1996) to compute the effective founder number for myped.  Note that results from
00319 # this function will not necessarily match those from a_effective_founders_lacy().
00320 # Boichard's algorithm requires information about the GENERATION of animals.  If you
00321 # do not provide an input pedigree with generations things may not work.  By default
00322 # the most recent generation -- the generation with the largest generation ID -- will
00323 # be used as the reference population.
00324 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
00325 # @param a A numerator relationship matrix (optional).
00326 # @param gen Generation of interest.
00327 # @retval The effective founder number.
00328 def a_effective_founders_boichard(pedobj, a='', gen=''):
00329     """
00330     The algorithm in Appendix A of Boichard et al. (1996) is not very well written.
00331     a_effective_founders_boichard() implements that algorithm (successfully, I hope).
00332     Note that answers from this function will not necessarily match those from
00333     a_effective_founders_lacy().
00334     """
00335     try: logging.info('Entered a_effective_founders_boichard()')
00336     except: pass
00337     if not a:
00338         try:
00339             a = pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix(pedobj.pedigree,pedobj.kw)
00340         except:
00341             return -999.9
00342     l = len(pedobj.pedigree)
00343     # count founders and descendants
00344     n_f = 0
00345     n_d = 0
00346     fs = []
00347     ds = []
00348     gens = []
00349     ngen = 0    # number of individuals in the most recent generation
00350     mp = str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent'])
00351     # loop through the pedigree quickly and count founders and descendants
00352     # also, make a list of generations present in the pedigree
00353     for i in range(l):
00354         animalid = int(pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID)
00355         if pedobj.pedigree[i].founder == 'y' and str(animalid) != mp:
00356             n_f = n_f + 1
00357             fs.append(animalid)
00358         elif animalid != mp:
00359             n_d = n_d + 1
00360             ds.append(animalid)
00361         else:
00362             pass
00363         #g = int(pedobj.pedigree[i].gen)
00364         g = pedobj.pedigree[i].gen
00365         if g in gens:
00366             pass
00367         else:
00368             gens.append(g)
00369     # OK - now we have a list of generations sorted in reverse (descending) order
00370     gens.sort()
00371     gens.reverse()
00372     #print 'gens : %s' % (gens)
00373     #print 'fs : %s' % (fs)
00374     #print 'ds : %s' % (ds)
00375     # make a copy of pedobj.pedigree
00376     tempped = pedobj.pedigree[:]
00377     # reverse the elements of tempped in place
00378     # now animals are ordered from oldest to youngest in tempped
00379     tempped.reverse()
00380     # form q, a vector of that will contain the probabilities of gene origin when we are done
00381     # We are going to initialize a vector of numpy.zeros to form q, and then we will add ones to q that
00382     # correspond to members of the youngest generation.
00383     q = numpy.zeros([l],'d')
00384     for i in range(l):
00385         # If the user did not explicitly ask for an analysis of a particular generation then use
00386     # the most recent generation.
00387         if not gen:
00388             gen = gens[0]
00389         if pedobj.pedigree[i].gen == gens[0]:
00390             # be careful messing with this or the elements of q will end up in the wrong
00391             # columns
00392             q[i] = 1.
00393             ngen = ngen + 1
00394         else:
00395             pass
00396     #print 'DEBUG (e_f_b): q : %s' % (q)
00397     # loop through the pedigree and form the final version of q (the vector of
00398     # individual contributions)
00399     for i in range(l):
00400         animalid = int(tempped[i].animalID)
00401         sireid = int(tempped[i].sireID)
00402         damid = int(tempped[i].damID)
00403         if sireid == mp and damid == mp:
00404             # both parents unknown
00405             pass
00406         elif str(sireid) == mp:
00407             # sire unknown, dam known
00408             q[i] = q[animalid-1] * 0.5
00409             q[damid-1] = q[damid-1] + (0.5 * q[animalid-1])
00410         elif str(damid) == mp:
00411             # sire known, dam unknown
00412             q[animalid-1] * 0.5
00413             q[sireid-1] = q[sireid-1] + (0.5 * q[animalid-1])
00414         else:
00415             # both parents known
00416             q[sireid-1] = q[sireid-1] + (0.5 * q[animalid-1])
00417             q[damid-1] = q[damid-1] + (0.5 * q[animalid-1])
00418     #print q
00419     # divide the elements of q by the number of individuals in the pedigree.  this should
00420     # ensure that the founder contributions sum to 1.
00421     q = q / ngen
00422     #print 'DEBUG (e_f_b): q : %s' % (q)
00423     # accumulate the sum of squared founder contributions
00424     sum_sq = 0.
00425     sum_fn = 0.
00426     #print fs
00427     for i in fs:
00428         sum_sq = sum_sq + ( q[i-1] * q[i-1] )
00429         sum_fn = sum_fn + q[i-1]
00430     #print '='*60
00431     #print 'sum_fn:\t%s' % (sum_fn)
00432     #print 'sum_sq:\t%s' % (sum_sq)
00433     if sum_sq == 0.:
00434         f_e = 0.
00435     else:
00436         f_e = 1. / sum_sq
00437     if pedobj.kw['messages'] == 'verbose':
00438         print '='*60
00439         print 'animals:\t%s' % (l)
00440         print 'founders:\t%s' % (n_f)
00441         print 'descendants:\t%s' % (n_d)
00442         print 'f_e:\t\t%5.3f' % (f_e)
00443         print '='*60
00444 
00445     # write some output to a file for later use
00446     outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_fe_boichard_','.dat')
00447     aout = open(outputfile,'w')
00448     line = '='*60+'\n'
00449     aout.write('%s\n' % line)
00450     aout.write('q: %s\n' % q)
00451     aout.write('%s founders: %s\n' % (n_f,fs))
00452     aout.write('%s descendants: %s\n' % (n_d,ds))
00453     aout.write('generations: %s\n' % gens)
00454     aout.write('%s animals in generation %s\n' % (ngen,gens[0]))
00455     aout.write('effective number of founders: %s\n' % f_e)
00456     aout.write('%s\n' % line)
00457     aout.close()
00458 
00459     try: logging.info('Exited a_effective_founders_boichard()')
00460     except: pass
00461     return f_e
00462 
00463 ##
00464 # a_effective_ancestors_definite() uses the algorithm in Appendix B of Boichard et al.
00465 # (1996) to compute the effective ancestor number for a myped pedigree.
00466 # NOTE: One problem here is that if you pass a pedigree WITHOUT generations and error
00467 # is not thrown.  You simply end up wth a list of generations that contains the default
00468 # value for Animal() objects, 0.
00469 # Boichard's algorithm requires information about the GENERATION of animals.  If you
00470 # do not provide an input pedigree with generations things may not work.  By default
00471 # the most recent generation -- the generation with the largest generation ID -- will
00472 # be used as the reference population.
00473 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
00474 # @param a A numerator relationship matrix (optional).
00475 # @param gen Generation of interest.
00476 # @retval The effective ancestor number.
00477 def a_effective_ancestors_definite(pedobj, a='', gen=''):
00478     """
00479     The algorithm in Appendix B of Boichard et al. (1996) is not very well written.
00480     a_effective_ancestors_definite() implements that algorithm (successfully, I hope).
00481 
00482     NOTE: One problem here is that if you pass a pedigree WITHOUT generations an error
00483     is not thrown.  You simply end up wth a list of generations that contains the
00484     default value for Animal() objects, 0.
00485     """
00486     try: logging.info('Entered a_effective_ancestors_definite()')
00487     except: pass
00488     #print '='*80
00489     if not a:
00490         try:
00491             a = pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix(pedobj.pedigree,pedobj.kw)
00492         except:
00493             return -999.9
00494     l = len(pedobj.pedigree)  # number of animals in the pedigree file
00495     # count founders and descendants
00496     n_f = 0     # number of founders
00497     n_d = 0     # number of descendants
00498     fs = []     # list of founders
00499     ds = []     # list of descendants
00500     gens = []       # list of generation IDs in the pedigree
00501     ancestors = []  # list of ancestors already processed
00502     contribs = {}   # ancestor contributions
00503     ngen = 0        # number of individuals in the most recent generation
00504     mp = str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent'])
00505     # Loop through the pedigree quickly and count founders and descendants
00506     # also, make a list of generations present in the pedigree
00507     for i in range(l):
00508         g = pedobj.pedigree[i].gen
00509         if g in gens:
00510             pass
00511         else:
00512             gens.append(g)
00513     gens.sort()
00514     #print '[DEBUG]: gens: %s' % (gens)
00515     if gens[-1] == -999:
00516         try: logging.warning('pyp_metrics/a_effective_ancestors_definite() assumes that generations are defined in the pedigree.  That is not the case with %s.  Solutions from this routine may be inaccurate or nonsensical.', pedobj.kw['pedname'])
00517         except: pass
00518     for i in range(l):
00519     #print 'DEBUG: Animal: %s\tGen: %s' % (pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID,pedobj.pedigree[i].gen)
00520         if pedobj.pedigree[i].gen != gens[len(gens)-1]:
00521             n_f = n_f + 1
00522             fs.append(int(pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID))
00523         else:
00524             n_d = n_d + 1
00525             ds.append(int(pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID))
00526     # OK - now we have a list of generations sorted in reverse (descending) order
00527     ngen = len(gens)
00528     gens.sort()
00529     #print 'DEBUG: gens: %s' % (gens)
00530     #print 'DEBUG: ancestors: %s' % (fs)
00531     gens.reverse()
00532     # make a copy of pedobj.pedigree - note that tempped = pedobj.pedigree would only have created a reference to
00533     # pedobj.pedigree, not an actual separate copy of pedobj.pedigree.
00534     tempped = pedobj.pedigree[:]
00535     # now animals are ordered from oldest to youngest in tempped
00536     tempped.reverse()
00537     # form q, a vector of that will contain the probabilities of gene origin when we are done
00538     # We are going to initialize a vector of numpy.zeros to form q, and then we will add ones to q that
00539     # correspond to members of the youngest generation.
00540     younglist = []
00541     q = numpy.zeros([l],'d')
00542     for i in range(l):
00543         # If the user did not explicitly ask for an analysis of a particular generation then use
00544         # the most recent generation.
00545         if not gen:
00546             gen = gens[0]
00547         #print 'DEBUG: Most recent generation = %s' % (gen)
00548         if pedobj.pedigree[i].gen == gen:
00549             q[i] = 1.
00550             younglist.append(pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID)
00551     ngen = len(younglist)
00552     #print 'DEBUG: Young animals (n=%s) = %s' % (ngen,younglist)
00553     #
00554     # Algorithm B, Step 1
00555     #
00556     #print 'DEBUG: q : %s' % (q)
00557     # loop through the pedigree and form the final version of q (the vector of
00558     # individual contributions)
00559     for i in range(l):
00560         animalid = int(tempped[i].animalID)
00561         sireid = int(tempped[i].sireID)
00562         damid = int(tempped[i].damID)
00563         if str(sireid) == mp and str(damid) == mp:
00564             # both parents unknown
00565             pass
00566         elif str(sireid) == mp:
00567             # sire unknown, dam known
00568             q[i] = q[animalid-1] * 0.5
00569             q[damid-1] = q[damid-1] + (0.5 * q[animalid-1])
00570         elif str(damid) == mp:
00571             # sire known, dam unknown
00572             q[animalid-1] * 0.5
00573             q[sireid-1] = q[sireid-1] + (0.5 * q[animalid-1])
00574         else:
00575             # both parents known
00576             q[sireid-1] = q[sireid-1] + (0.5 * q[animalid-1])
00577             q[damid-1] = q[damid-1] + (0.5 * q[animalid-1])
00578     # Divide the elements of q by the number of individuals in the pedigree.  this should
00579     # ensure that the founder contributions sum to 1.
00580     for y in younglist:
00581         q[int(y)-1] = 0.
00582     #print 'DEBUG: Uncorrected q: %s' % (q)
00583     q = q / ngen
00584     #print 'DEBUG: q: %s' % (q)
00585 
00586     # Find largest value of q
00587     max_p_index = numpy.argmax(q)
00588     max_p = q[max_p_index]
00589     #print 'DEBUG: Animal %s had the largest marginal contribution (%s) (index: %s) this round.' % (tempped[l-max_p_index-1].animalID,max_p,max_p_index)
00590     contribs[pedobj.pedigree[max_p_index].animalID] = max_p
00591     picked = []
00592     picked.append(l-max_p_index-1)
00593     #print '\t\tWas sire: %s, dam %s' % (tempped[l-max_p_index-1].sireID,tempped[l-max_p_index-1].damID)
00594     tempped[l-max_p_index-1].sireID = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']          # delete sire in pedobj.pedigree (forward order)
00595     tempped[l-max_p_index-1].damID = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']           # delete dam in pedobj.pedigree (forward order)
00596     #print '\t\tNow sire: %s, dam %s' % (tempped[l-max_p_index-1].sireID,tempped[l-max_p_index-1].damID)
00597     ancestors.append(pedobj.pedigree[max_p_index].animalID)   # add the animal with largest q to the
00598                                                     # list of ancestors
00599 
00600     for j in range(n_f-1):
00601         #print '-'*60
00602 
00603         # form q, the vector of contributions we are going to use
00604         q = numpy.zeros([l],'d')
00605         a = numpy.zeros([l],'d')
00606         for i in range(l):
00607             if pedobj.pedigree[i].gen == gens[0]:
00608                 q[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID)-1] = 1.
00609         for j in ancestors:
00610             a[int(j)-1] = 1.
00611         #print 'DEBUG: a: %s' % (a)
00612 
00613         # Loop through pedigree to process q
00614         #-- q must be processed from YOUNGEST to OLDEST
00615         for i in range(len(tempped)):
00616             if int(tempped[i].sireID) == pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and int(tempped[i].damID) == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00617                 # both parents unknown
00618                 pass
00619             elif int(tempped[i].sireID) == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00620                 # sire unknown, dam known
00621                 q[int(tempped[i].damID)-1] = q[int(tempped[i].damID)-1] + (0.5 * q[int(tempped[i].animalID)-1])
00622             elif int(tempped[i].damID) == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00623                 # sire known, dam unknown
00624                 q[int(tempped[i].sireID)-1] = q[int(tempped[i].sireID)-1] + (0.5 * q[int(tempped[i].animalID)-1])
00625             else:
00626                 # both parents known
00627                 q[int(tempped[i].sireID)-1] = q[int(tempped[i].sireID)-1] + (0.5 * q[int(tempped[i].animalID)-1])
00628                 q[int(tempped[i].damID)-1] = q[int(tempped[i].damID)-1] + (0.5 * q[int(tempped[i].animalID)-1])
00629         #-- a must be processed from OLDEST to YOUNGEST
00630         tempped.reverse()
00631         for i in range(len(tempped)):
00632             #print '[DEBUG]: animal: %s, sire: %s, dam %s' % (tempped[i].animalID,tempped[i].sireID,tempped[i].damID)
00633             if int(tempped[i].sireID) == pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and int(tempped[i].damID) == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00634                 # both parents unknown
00635                 pass
00636             elif int(tempped[i].sireID) == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00637                 # sire unknown, dam known
00638                 a[i] = a[i] + ( 0.5 * a[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].damID)-1] )
00639             elif int(tempped[i].damID) == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00640                 # sire known, dam unknown
00641                 a[i] = a[i] + ( 0.5 * a[int(tempped[i].sireID)-1] )
00642             else:
00643                 # both parents known
00644                 a[i] = a[i] + ( 0.5 * a[int(tempped[i].sireID)-1] )
00645                 a[i] = a[i] + ( 0.5 * a[int(tempped[i].damID)-1] )
00646         tempped.reverse()
00647         for y in younglist:
00648                 q[int(y)-1] = 0.
00649 
00650         #print 'DEBUG: post q: %s' % (q)
00651         #print 'DEBUG: post a: %s' % (a)
00652         # Loop through the pedigree to process p
00653         p = numpy.zeros([l],'d')
00654         for i in range(l):
00655             p[i] = q[i] * ( 1. - a[i] )
00656             #print 'DEBUG: p[%s] = q[%s]*(1.-a[%s]) = %s*(1-%s) = %s' % (i,i,i,q[i],a[i],p[i]/ngen)
00657         p = p / ngen
00658 
00659         # Find largest p
00660         p_temp = p[:]
00661         #print 'DEBUG: p_temp: %s' % (p_temp)
00662         for y in younglist:
00663             p_temp[int(y)-1] = -1.
00664         p_temp = p_temp[::-1]
00665         #print 'DEBUG: picked: %s' % (picked)
00666         for c in picked:
00667             p_temp[int(c)] = -1.
00668             #print 'DEBUG: p_temp: %s' % (p_temp)
00669             max_p_index = numpy.argmax(p_temp)
00670             max_p = p_temp[max_p_index]
00671         #print 'DEBUG: Animal %s had the largest marginal contribution (%s) this round.' % (tempped[max_p_index].animalID,max_p)
00672         contribs[tempped[max_p_index].animalID] = max_p
00673         picked.append(max_p_index)
00674 
00675         # Delete the pedigree info for the animal with largest q
00676         #print 'DEBUG: Deleting parent information for animal %s' % (tempped[max_p_index].animalID)
00677         #print '\t\tWas sire: %s, dam %s' % (tempped[max_p_index].sireID,tempped[max_p_index].damID)
00678         tempped[max_p_index].sireID = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']          # delete sire in pedobj.pedigree (forward order)
00679         tempped[max_p_index].damID = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']           # delete dam in pedobj.pedigree (forward order)
00680         #print '\t\tNow sire: %s, dam %s' % (tempped[max_p_index].sireID,tempped[max_p_index].damID)
00681         ancestors.append(tempped[max_p_index].animalID)   # add the animal with largest q to the
00682                                                         # list of ancestors
00683         #print '[DEBUG]: ancestors: %s' % (ancestors)
00684 
00685     #print '[DEBUG]: contribs: %s' % (contribs)
00686     sum_p_sq = 0.
00687     for i in contribs.values():
00688         sum_p_sq = sum_p_sq + ( i * i )
00689     try:
00690         f_a = 1. / sum_p_sq
00691     except:
00692         f_a = 0.0
00693     if pedobj.kw['messages'] == 'verbose':
00694         print '='*60
00695         print 'animals:\t%s' % (l)
00696         print 'ancestors:\t%s' % (n_f)
00697         print 'descendants:\t%s' % (n_d)
00698         print 'f_a:\t\t%5.3f' % (f_a)
00699         print '='*60
00700     if pedobj.kw['debug_messages'] == 'verbose':
00701         print 'generations: %s' % (gens)
00702         print '%s animals in generation %s' % (ngen,gen)
00703         print 'ancestors: %s' % (ancestors)
00704         print 'ancestor contributions: %s' % (contribs)
00705         print 'DEBUG: f_a: %s' % (f_a)
00706     # write some output to a file for later use
00707     outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_fa_boichard_definite_','.dat')
00708     aout = open(outputfile,'w')
00709     line = '='*60+'\n'
00710     aout.write('%s\n' % line)
00711     aout.write('%s ancestors: %s\n' % (n_f,fs))
00712     aout.write('%s descendants: %s\n' % (n_d,ds))
00713     aout.write('generations: %s\n' % gens)
00714     aout.write('%s animals in generation %s\n' % (ngen,gens[0]))
00715     aout.write('effective number of ancestors: %s\n' % f_a)
00716     aout.write('ancestors: %s\n' % ancestors)
00717     aout.write('ancestor contributions: %s\n' % contribs)
00718     aout.write('%s\n' % line)
00719     aout.close()
00720 
00721     try: logging.info('Exited a_effective_ancestors_definite()')
00722     except: pass
00723     return f_a
00724 
00725 ##
00726 # a_effective_ancestors_indefinite() uses the approach outlined on pages 9 and 10 of
00727 # Boichard et al. (1996) to compute approximate upper and lower bounds for f_a.  This
00728 # is much more tractable for large pedigrees than the exact computation provided in
00729 # a_effective_ancestors_definite().
00730 # NOTE: One problem here is that if you pass a pedigree WITHOUT generations an error
00731 # is not thrown.  You simply end up wth a list of generations that contains the default
00732 # value for NewAnimal() objects, 0.
00733 # NOTE: If you pass a value of n that is greater than the actual number of ancestors in
00734 # the pedigree then strange things happen.  As a stop-gap, a_effective_ancestors_indefinite()
00735 # will detect that case and replace n with the number of founders - 1.
00736 # Boichard's algorithm requires information about the GENERATION of animals.  If you
00737 # do not provide an input pedigree with generations things may not work.  By default
00738 # the most recent generation -- the generation with the largest generation ID -- will
00739 # be used as the reference population.
00740 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
00741 # @param a A numerator relationship matrix (optional).
00742 # @param gen Generation of interest.
00743 # @param n The number of rounds to iterate for solutions.
00744 # @retval The effective ancestor number.
00745 def a_effective_ancestors_indefinite(pedobj, a='', gen='', n=25):
00746     """
00747     a_effective_ancestors_indefinite() uses the approach outlined on pages 9 and 10 of
00748     Boichard et al. (1996) to compute approximate upper and lower bounds for f_a.  This
00749     is much more tractable for large pedigrees than the exact computation provided in
00750     a_effective_ancestors_definite().
00751     """
00752     try: logging.info('Entered a_effective_ancestors_indefinite()')
00753     except: pass
00754     if not a:
00755         try:
00756             a = pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix(pedobj.pedigree,pedobj.kw)
00757         except:
00758             return -999.9, -999.9
00759     l = len(pedobj.pedigree)  # number of animals in the pedigree file
00760     # count founders and descendants
00761     n_f = 0     # number of founders
00762     n_d = 0     # number of descendants
00763     fs = []     # list of founders
00764     ds = []     # list of descendants
00765     gens = []       # list of generation IDs in the pedigree
00766     ancestors = []  # list of ancestors already processed
00767     contribs = {}   # ancestor contributions
00768     ngen = 0        # number of individuals in the most recent generation
00769     # Loop through the pedigree quickly and count founders and descendants
00770     # also, make a list of generations present in the pedigree
00771     for i in range(l):
00772         g = pedobj.pedigree[i].gen
00773         if g in gens:
00774             pass
00775         else:
00776             gens.append(g)
00777     gens.sort()
00778     for i in range(l):
00779         if pedobj.pedigree[i].gen != gens[len(gens)-1]:
00780             n_f = n_f + 1
00781             fs.append(int(pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID))
00782         else:
00783             n_d = n_d + 1
00784             ds.append(int(pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID))
00785     # OK - now we have a list of generations sorted in reverse (descending) order
00786     ngen = len(gens)
00787     gens.sort()
00788     gens.reverse()
00789     # make a copy of pedobj.pedigree - note that tempped = pedobj.pedigree would only have created a reference to
00790     # pedobj.pedigree, not an actual separate copy of pedobj.pedigree.
00791     tempped = pedobj.pedigree[:]
00792     # now animals are ordered from oldest to youngest in tempped
00793     tempped.reverse()
00794     # form q, a vector of that will contain the probabilities of gene origin when we are done
00795     # We are going to initialize a vector of numpy.zeros to form q, and then we will add ones to q that
00796     # correspond to members of the youngest generation.
00797     younglist = []
00798     q = numpy.zeros([l],'d')
00799     for i in range(l):
00800         # If the user did not explicitly ask for an analysis of a particular generation then use
00801         # the most recent generation.
00802         if not gen:
00803             gen = gens[0]
00804         if pedobj.pedigree[i].gen == gen:
00805             q[i] = 1.
00806             younglist.append(pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID)
00807     ngen = len(younglist)
00808     # loop through the pedigree and form the final version of q (the vector of
00809     # individual contributions)
00810     for i in range(l):
00811         if tempped[i].sireID == pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and tempped[i].damID == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00812             # both parents unknown
00813             pass
00814         elif tempped[i].sireID == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00815             # sire unknown, dam known
00816             q[i] = q[tempped[i].animalID-1] * 0.5
00817             q[tempped[i].damID-1] = q[tempped[i].damID-1] + (0.5 * q[tempped[i].animalID-1])
00818         elif tempped[i].damID == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00819             # sire known, dam unknown
00820             q[tempped[i].animalID-1] * 0.5
00821             q[tempped[i].sireID-1] = q[tempped[i].sireID-1] + (0.5 * q[tempped[i].animalID-1])
00822         else:
00823             # both parents known
00824             q[int(tempped[i].sireID)-1] = q[int(tempped[i].sireID)-1] + (0.5 * q[int(tempped[i].animalID)-1])
00825             q[int(tempped[i].damID)-1] = q[int(tempped[i].damID)-1] + (0.5 * q[int(tempped[i].animalID)-1])
00826     # divide the elements of q by the number of individuals in the pedigree.  this should
00827     # ensure that the founder contributions sum to 1.
00828     for y in younglist:
00829         q[int(y)-1] = 0.
00830     q = q / ngen
00831 
00832     # Find largest value of q
00833     max_p_index = numpy.argmax(q)
00834     max_p = q[max_p_index]
00835     contribs[pedobj.pedigree[max_p_index].animalID] = max_p
00836     picked = []
00837     picked.append(l-max_p_index-1)
00838     tempped[l-max_p_index-1].sireID = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']          # delete sire in pedobj.pedigree (forward order)
00839     tempped[l-max_p_index-1].damID = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']           # delete dam in pedobj.pedigree (forward order)
00840     ancestors.append(pedobj.pedigree[max_p_index].animalID)   # add the animal with largest q to the
00841                             # list of ancestors
00842 
00843     # Tricky here... now we have to deal with the fact that we may not want as many contributions are there
00844     # are ancestors.
00845     if n >= ( l - n_d ):
00846         print '-'*60
00847         print 'WARNING: (pyp_metrics/a_effective_ancestors_indefinite()): Setting n (%s) to be equal to the actual number of founders (%s) in the pedigree!' % (n, n_f)
00848         n = n - 1
00849     if n_f > n:
00850         _this_many = n
00851     else:
00852         _this_many = n_f
00853     for _t in range(_this_many-1):
00854         for j in range(n_f-1):
00855             # form q, the vector of contributions we are going to use
00856             q = numpy.zeros([l],'d')
00857             a = numpy.zeros([l],'d')
00858             for i in range(l):
00859                 if pedobj.pedigree[i].gen == gens[0]:
00860                     q[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID)-1] = 1.
00861             for j in ancestors:
00862                 a[int(j)-1] = 1.
00863 
00864             # Loop through pedigree to process q
00865             #-- q must be processed from YOUNGEST to OLDEST
00866             for i in range(len(tempped)):
00867                 if int(tempped[i].sireID) == pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and int(tempped[i].damID) == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00868                     # both parents unknown
00869                     pass
00870                 elif int(tempped[i].sireID) == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00871                     # sire unknown, dam known
00872                     q[int(tempped[i].damID)-1] = q[int(tempped[i].damID)-1] + (0.5 * q[int(tempped[i].animalID)-1])
00873                 elif int(tempped[i].damID) == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00874                     # sire known, dam unknown
00875                     q[int(tempped[i].sireID)-1] = q[int(tempped[i].sireID)-1] + (0.5 * q[int(tempped[i].animalID)-1])
00876                 else:
00877                     # both parents known
00878                     q[int(tempped[i].sireID)-1] = q[int(tempped[i].sireID)-1] + (0.5 * q[int(tempped[i].animalID)-1])
00879                     q[int(tempped[i].damID)-1] = q[int(tempped[i].damID)-1] + (0.5 * q[int(tempped[i].animalID)-1])
00880             #-- a must be processed from OLDEST to YOUNGEST
00881             tempped.reverse()
00882             for i in range(len(tempped)):
00883                 if int(tempped[i].sireID) == pedobj.kw['missing_parent'] and int(tempped[i].damID) == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00884                     # both parents unknown
00885                     pass
00886                 elif int(tempped[i].sireID) == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00887                     # sire unknown, dam known
00888                     a[i] = a[i] + ( 0.5 * a[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].damID)-1] )
00889                 elif int(tempped[i].damID) == pedobj.kw['missing_parent']:
00890                     # sire known, dam unknown
00891                     a[i] = a[i] + ( 0.5 * a[int(tempped[i].sireID)-1] )
00892                 else:
00893                     # both parents known
00894                     a[i] = a[i] + ( 0.5 * a[int(tempped[i].sireID)-1] )
00895                     a[i] = a[i] + ( 0.5 * a[int(tempped[i].damID)-1] )
00896             tempped.reverse()
00897             for y in younglist:
00898                 q[int(y)-1] = 0.
00899 
00900             # Loop through the pedigree to process p
00901             p = numpy.zeros([l],'d')
00902             for i in range(l):
00903                 p[i] = q[i] * ( 1. - a[i] )
00904             p = p / ngen
00905 
00906             # Find largest p
00907             p_temp = p[:]
00908             for y in younglist:
00909                 p_temp[int(y)-1] = -1.
00910             p_temp = p_temp[::-1]
00911             for c in picked:
00912                 p_temp[int(c)] = -1.
00913 
00914             max_p_index = numpy.argmax(p_temp)
00915             max_p = p_temp[max_p_index]
00916             contribs[tempped[max_p_index].animalID] = max_p
00917             picked.append(max_p_index)
00918 
00919             # Delete the pedigree info for the animal with largest q
00920             tempped[max_p_index].sireID = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']          # delete sire in pedobj.pedigree (forward order)
00921             tempped[max_p_index].damID = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']           # delete dam in pedobj.pedigree (forward order)
00922             ancestors.append(tempped[max_p_index].animalID)     # add the animal with largest q to the
00923                                         # list of ancestors
00924 
00925     # Now compute the upper and lower bounds for f_a based on the founder contributions.
00926     #print 'DEBUG: n: %s, n_f: %s' % (n, n_f)
00927     #print 'DEBUG: contribs.values(): %s' % (contribs.values())
00928     n_contrib = len(contribs.values())-1
00929     _c = 0.
00930     sum_p_sq = 0.
00931     # Compute f_u, the upper bound of f_a
00932     for i in contribs.values():
00933         if i >= 0.0:
00934             _c = _c + i
00935         sum_p_sq = sum_p_sq + ( i * i )
00936     #print 'DEBUG: _c: %s' % (_c)
00937     try:
00938         if n_f <= n_f:
00939             _df = 1
00940         else:
00941             _df = n_f - n
00942         f_u =  1. / ( sum_p_sq + ( ( (1. - _c) ** 2) / _df ) )
00943     except:
00944         f_u = 0.
00945     # Compute f_l, the lower bound of f_a
00946     try:
00947         _denom = 0.
00948         for i in contribs.values():
00949             _p_sq = i ** 2
00950             try:
00951                 _m = ( (1. - _c) / i )
00952             except:
00953                 _m = 0.
00954             _denom = _denom + ( _p_sq + ( _m * ( i ** 2) ) )
00955         f_l = 1. / _denom
00956     except:
00957         f_l = 0.
00958     if pedobj.kw['messages'] == 'verbose':
00959         print '='*60
00960         print 'animals:\t%s' % (l)
00961         print 'founders:\t%s' % (n_f)
00962         print 'descendants:\t%s' % (n_d)
00963         print 'f_l:\t\t%5.3f' % (f_l)
00964         print 'f_u:\t\t%5.3f' % (f_u)
00965         print '='*60
00966 
00967     # write some output to a file for later use
00968     outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_fa_boichard_indefinite_','.dat')
00969     aout = open(outputfile,'w')
00970     line = '='*60+'\n'
00971     aout.write('%s\n' % line)
00972     aout.write('%s founders: %s\n' % (n_f,fs))
00973     aout.write('%s descendants: %s\n' % (n_d,ds))
00974     aout.write('generations: %s\n' % gens)
00975     aout.write('%s animals in generation %s\n' % (ngen,gens[0]))
00976     aout.write('f_l:\t\t%5.3f' % f_l)
00977     aout.write('f_u:\t\t%5.3f' % f_u)
00978     aout.write('ancestors: %s\n' % ancestors)
00979     aout.write('ancestor contributions: %s\n' % contribs)
00980     aout.write('%s\n' % line)
00981     aout.close()
00982 
00983     try: logging.info('Exited a_effective_ancestors_indefinite()')
00984     except: pass
00985     return f_l, f_u
00986 
00987 ##
00988 # a_coefficients() writes population average coefficients of inbreeding and
00989 # relationship to a file, as well as individual animal IDs and coefficients of
00990 # inbreeding.  Some pedigrees are too large for fast_a_matrix() or fast_a_matrix_r()
00991 # -- an array that large cannot be allocated due to memory restrictions -- and will
00992 # result in a value of -999.9 for all outputs.
00993 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
00994 # @param a A numerator relationship matrix (optional).
00995 # @param method If no relationship matrix is passed, determines which procedure should be called to build one (nrm|frm).
00996 # @retval A dictionary of non-zero individual inbreeding coefficients.
00997 def a_coefficients(pedobj, a='', method='nrm'):
00998     """
00999     Write population average coefficients of inbreeding and relationship to a
01000     file, as well as individual animal IDs and coefficients of inbreeding.  Some
01001     pedigrees are too large for fast_a_matrix() or fast_a_matrix_r()
01002     -- an array that large cannot be allocated due to memory restrictions -- and will
01003     result in a value of -999.9 for all outputs.
01004     """
01005     try: logging.info('Entered a_coefficients()')
01006     except: pass
01007     if method not in ['nrm','frm']:
01008         method = 'nrm'
01009     if pedobj.kw['form_nrm']:
01010         a = pedobj.nrm.nrm
01011     if not pedobj.kw['form_nrm'] and not a:
01012         try:
01013             if method == 'nrm':
01014                 a = pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix(pedobj.pedigree,pedobj.kw)
01015             else:
01016                 a = pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix_r(pedobj.pedigree,pedobj.kw)
01017         except:
01018             a = []
01019             a.append(-999.9)
01020             return a
01021     #print a
01022     l = len(pedobj.pedigree)
01023     f_avg = f_sum = f_n = 0.
01024     fnz_avg = fnz_sum = fnz_n = 0.
01025     r_avg = r_sum = r_n = 0.
01026     rnz_avg = rnz_sum = rnz_n = 0.
01027 
01028     # Populate a dictionary with individual non-zero COI
01029     individual_coi = {}
01030 
01031     # calculate average coefficients of inbreeding
01032     for row in range(l):
01033         f_sum = f_sum + a[row,row] - 1.
01034         f_n = f_n + 1
01035     f_avg = f_sum / f_n
01036 
01037     # calculate average non-zero coefficients of inbreeding
01038     for row in range(l):
01039         if ( a[row,row] > 1. ):
01040             fnz_sum = fnz_sum + a[row,row] - 1.
01041             fnz_n = fnz_n + 1
01042             individual_coi[pedobj.pedigree[row].animalID] = a[row,row]-1.
01043     if fnz_sum > 0.:
01044         fnz_avg = fnz_sum / fnz_n
01045     else:
01046         fnz_avg = 0
01047 
01048     # calculate average coefficients of relationship
01049     for row in range(l):
01050         for col in range(row):
01051             r_sum = r_sum + a[row,col]
01052             r_n = r_n + 1
01053     r_avg = r_sum / r_n
01054 
01055     # calculate average non-zero coefficients of relationship
01056     for row in range(l):
01057         for col in range(row):
01058             if ( a[row,col] > 0. ):
01059                 rnz_sum = rnz_sum + a[row,col]
01060                 rnz_n = rnz_n + 1
01061     if rnz_sum > 0.:
01062         rnz_avg = rnz_sum / rnz_n
01063     else:
01064         rnz_avg = 0.
01065 
01066     # calculate the average relationship between each individual in the population
01067     # and all other animals in the population and write it to a file
01068     outputfile2 = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_rel_to_pop_','.dat')
01069     aout2 = open(outputfile2,'w')
01070     line1_2 = '# Average relationship to population (renumbered ID, r)\n'
01071     for row in range(l):
01072         r_pop_avg = 0.
01073         for col in range(l):
01074             if ( row == col ):
01075                 pass
01076             else:
01077                 r_pop_avg = r_pop_avg + a[row,col]
01078         r_pop_avg = r_pop_avg / l
01079         line = '%s %s\n' % (pedobj.pedigree[row].animalID,r_pop_avg)
01080         aout2.write(line)
01081     aout2.close()
01082 
01083     # output population average coefficients
01084     outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_population_coefficients_','.dat')
01085     aout = open(outputfile,'w')
01086     line = '='*60+'\n'
01087     aout.write('%s\n' % line)
01088     aout.write('# Population average coefficients of inbreeding and relationship\n')
01089     aout.write('#   f_avg [fnz_avg] = average [nonzero] coefficient of inbreeding\n')
01090     aout.write('#   f_n [fnz_n] = number of diagonal elements (animals) [>1] in the relationship matrix\n')
01091     aout.write('#   f_sum [fnz_sum] = sum of [nonzero] coefficients of inbreeding\n')
01092     aout.write('#   r_avg [rnz_avg] = average [nonzero] coefficient of relationship\n')
01093     aout.write('#   r_n [rnz_n] = number of [non-zero] elements in the upper off-diagonal of A\n')
01094     aout.write('#   r_sum [rnz_sum] = sum of [non-zero] elements in the upper off-diagonal of A\n')
01095     aout.write('f_n: %s\nf_sum: %s\nf_avg: %5.3f\n' % (f_n,f_sum,f_avg))
01096     aout.write('fnz_n: %s\nfnz_sum: %s\nfnz_avg: %5.3f\n' % (fnz_n,fnz_sum,fnz_avg))
01097     aout.write('r_n: %s\nr_sum: %s\nr_avg: %5.3f\n' % (r_n,r_sum,r_avg))
01098     aout.write('rnz_n: %s\nrnz_sum: %s\nrnz_avg: %5.3f\n' % (rnz_n,rnz_sum,rnz_avg))
01099     aout.write('%s\n' % line)
01100     aout.close()
01101     # output individual coefficients of inbreeding
01102     outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_individual_coefficients_','.dat')
01103     aout = open(outputfile,'w')
01104     aout.write('# individual coefficients of inbreeding\n')
01105     aout.write('# animalID f_a\n')
01106     for row in range(l):
01107         aout.write('%s\t%6.4f\n' % pedobj.pedigree[row].animalID,a[row,row]-1.)
01108     aout.close()
01109 
01110     try: logging.info('Exited a_coefficients()')
01111     except: pass
01112     return individual_coi
01113 
01114 ##
01115 # a_fast_coefficients() writes population average coefficients of inbreeding and
01116 # relationship to a file, as well as individual animal IDs and coefficients of
01117 # inbreeding.  It returns a list of non-zero individual CoI.
01118 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
01119 # @param a A numerator relationship matrix (optional).
01120 # @param method If no relationship matrix is passed, determines which procedure should be called to build one (nrm|frm).
01121 # @param debug Print deubgging messages if 1, don't print otherwise.
01122 # @param storage Use dense or sparse matrix storage.
01123 # @retval A dictionary of non-zero individual inbreeding coefficients.
01124 def fast_a_coefficients(pedobj, a='', method='nrm', debug=0, storage='dense'):
01125     """
01126     a_fast_coefficients() writes population average coefficients of inbreeding and
01127     relationship to a file, as well as individual animal IDs and coefficients of
01128     inbreeding.  It returns a list of non-zero individual CoI.
01129     """
01130     try: logging.info('Entered fast_a_coefficients()')
01131     except: pass
01132     if method not in ['nrm','frm']:
01133         method = 'nrm'
01134     if storage not in ['dense','sparse']:
01135         storage = 'dense'
01136     if pedobj.kw['form_nrm']:
01137         a = pedobj.nrm.nrm
01138     if not pedobj.kw['form_nrm'] and not a:
01139         try:
01140             #if method == 'nrm':
01141             #    a = pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix(pedobj.pedigree,pedobj.kw,method=storage)
01142             #else:
01143             #    a = pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix_r(pedobj.pedigree,pedobj.kw,method=storage)
01144             a = pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix(pedobj.pedigree,pedobj.kw,method=storage)
01145         except:
01146             a = []
01147             a.append(-999.9)
01148             return a
01149 
01150     l = len(pedobj.pedigree)
01151     f_avg = f_sum = f_n = 0.
01152     fnz_avg = fnz_sum = fnz_n = 0.
01153     r_avg = r_sum = r_n = 0.
01154     rnz_avg = rnz_sum = rnz_n = 0.
01155 
01156     # Populate a dictionary with individual non-zero COI
01157     individual_coi = {}
01158 
01159     for row in range(l):
01160 
01161         # Do inbreeding things here in the outer loop
01162         f_sum = f_sum + ( a[row,row] - 1. )
01163         f_n = f_n + 1
01164         if ( a[row,row] > 1. ) :
01165                 fnz_sum = fnz_sum + ( a[row,row] - 1. )
01166                 fnz_n = fnz_n + 1
01167                 individual_coi[pedobj.pedigree[row].animalID] = a[row,row]-1.
01168 
01169         for col in range(row):
01170         # Do relationship things here in the inner loop
01171             r_sum = r_sum + a[row,col]
01172             r_n = r_n + 1
01173             if ( a[row,col] > 0. ):
01174                 rnz_sum = rnz_sum + a[row,col]
01175                 rnz_n = rnz_n + 1
01176 
01177     if f_sum > 0.:
01178         f_avg = f_sum / f_n
01179     else:
01180         f_avg = 0.
01181     if fnz_sum > 0.:
01182         fnz_avg = fnz_sum / fnz_n
01183     else:
01184         fnz_avg = 0.
01185     if r_sum > 0.:
01186         r_avg = r_sum / r_n
01187     else:
01188         r_avg = 0.
01189     if rnz_sum > 0.:
01190         rnz_avg = rnz_sum / rnz_n
01191     else:
01192         rnz_avg = 0.
01193 
01194     if pedobj.kw['file_io']:
01195 
01196         # calculate the average relationship between each individual in the population
01197         # and all other animals in the population and write it to a file
01198         outputfile2 = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_rel_to_pop_','.dat')
01199         aout2 = open(outputfile2,'w')
01200         line1_2 = '# Average relationship to population (renumbered ID, r)\n'
01201         for row in range(l):
01202             r_pop_avg = 0.
01203             for col in range(l):
01204                 if ( row == col ):
01205                     pass
01206                 else:
01207                     r_pop_avg = r_pop_avg + a[row,col]
01208             r_pop_avg = r_pop_avg / l
01209             line = '%s %s\n' % (pedobj.pedigree[row].animalID,r_pop_avg)
01210             aout2.write(line)
01211         aout2.close()
01212         # output population average coefficients
01213         outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_population_coefficients_','.dat')
01214         aout = open(outputfile,'w')
01215         line = '='*60+'\n'
01216         aout.write('%s\n' % line)
01217         aout.write('# Population average coefficients of inbreeding and relationship (fast_a_coefficients)\n')
01218         aout.write('#   f_avg [fnz_avg] = average [nonzero] coefficient of inbreeding\n')
01219         aout.write('#   f_n [fnz_n] = number of diagonal elements (animals) [>1] in the relationship matrix\n')
01220         aout.write('#   f_sum [fnz_sum] = sum of [nonzero] coefficients of inbreeding\n')
01221         aout.write('#   r_avg [rnz_avg] = average [nonzero] coefficient of relationship\n')
01222         aout.write('#   r_n [rnz_n] = number of [non-zero] elements in the upper off-diagonal of A\n')
01223         aout.write('#   r_sum [rnz_sum] = sum of [non-zero] elements in the upper off-diagonal of A\n')
01224         aout.write('f_n: %s\nf_sum: %s\nf_avg: %5.3f\n' % (f_n,f_sum,f_avg))
01225         aout.write('fnz_n: %s\nfnz_sum: %s\nfnz_avg: %5.3f\n' % (fnz_n,fnz_sum,fnz_avg))
01226         aout.write('r_n: %s\nr_sum: %s\nr_avg: %5.3f\n' % (r_n,r_sum,r_avg))
01227         aout.write('rnz_n: %s\nrnz_sum: %s\nrnz_avg: %5.3f\n' % (rnz_n,rnz_sum,rnz_avg))
01228         aout.write('%s\n' % line)
01229         aout.close()
01230         # output individual coefficients of inbreeding
01231         outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_individual_coefficients_','.dat')
01232         aout = open(outputfile,'w')
01233         aout.write('# individual coefficients of inbreeding\n')
01234         aout.write('# animalID f_a\n')
01235         for row in range(l):
01236             aout.write('%s\t%6.4f\n' % (pedobj.pedigree[row].animalID,a[row,row]-1.))
01237         aout.close()
01238 
01239     try: logging.info('Exited fast_a_coefficients()')
01240     except: pass
01241     return individual_coi
01242 
01243 ##
01244 # theoretical_ne_from_metadata() computes the theoretical effective population
01245 # size based on the number of sires and dams contained in a pedigree metadata
01246 # object.  Writes results to an output file.
01247 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
01248 # @retval True (1) on success, false (0) on failure
01249 def theoretical_ne_from_metadata(pedobj):
01250     """
01251     theoretical_ne_from_metadata() computes the theoretical effective population
01252     size based on the number of sires and dams contained in a pedigree metadata
01253     object.  Writes results to an output file.
01254     """
01255     try: logging.info('Entered theoretical_ne_from_metadata()')
01256     except: pass
01257     try:
01258         ns = float(pedobj.metadata.num_unique_sires)
01259         nd = float(pedobj.metadata.num_unique_dams)
01260         ne = 1. / ( (1./(4.*ns)) + (1./(4.*nd)) )
01261         outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_ne_from_metadata_','.dat')
01262         aout = open(outputfile,'w')
01263         line = '='*60+'\n'
01264         aout.write('%s\n' % line)
01265         aout.write('# Theoretical effective population size (N_e)\n')
01266         aout.write('#   n_sires = number of sires\n')
01267         aout.write('#   n_dams = number of dams\n')
01268         aout.write('#   n_e = effective population size\n')
01269         aout.write('n_sires: %s\n' % ns)
01270         aout.write('n_dams: %s\n' % nd)
01271         aout.write('n_e: %s\n' % ne)
01272         aout.write('%s\n' % line)
01273         aout.close()
01274         _return = 1
01275     except:
01276         _return = 0
01277 
01278     try: logging.info('Exited theoretical_ne_from_metadata()')
01279     except: pass
01280     return _return
01281 
01282 ##
01283 # pedigree_completeness() computes the proportion of known ancestors in the pedigree of
01284 # each animal in the population for a user-determined number of generations.    Also,
01285 # the mean pedcomps for all animals and for all animals that are not founders are
01286 # computed as summary statistics.
01287 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
01288 # @param gens The number of generations the pedigree should be traced for completeness.
01289 # @retval Dictionary of summary statistics
01290 def pedigree_completeness(pedobj, gens=4):
01291     """
01292     pedigree_completeness() computes the proportion of known ancestors in the
01293     pedigree of each animal in the population for a user-determined number of
01294     generations. Also, the mean pedcomps for all animals and for all animals
01295     that are not founders are computed as summary statistics.
01296     """
01297     try: logging.info('Entered pedigree_completeness()')
01298     except: pass
01299     l = len(pedobj.pedigree)
01300     #print l
01301     c_summary = {}
01302     mp = str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent'])
01303 
01304     # All-animal summary stats
01305     c_max = 0.0
01306     c_min = 1.0
01307     c_cnt = 0
01308     c_sum = 0
01309     # Non-founder summary stats
01310     nf_c_max = 0.0
01311     nf_c_min = 1.0
01312     nf_c_cnt = 0
01313     nf_c_sum = 0
01314 
01315     for i in range(l):
01316         animalid = int(pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID)
01317         sireid = int(pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID)
01318         damid = int(pedobj.pedigree[i].damID)
01319         animalname = pedobj.pedigree[i].name
01320         sirename = pedobj.pedigree[pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID-1].name
01321         damname = pedobj.pedigree[pedobj.pedigree[i].damID-1].name
01322         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
01323             print 'Animal: %s (%s)' % (animalid, animalname)
01324             if str(sireid) != mp:
01325                 print '\tSire: %s (%s)' % (sireid, sirename)
01326             if str(damid) != mp:
01327                 print '\tDam: %s (%s)' % (damid, damname)
01328         # Founders are easy to deal with!
01329         if pedobj.pedigree[i].founder == 'y':
01330             pedobj.pedigree[i].pedcomp = 0.0
01331         if str(sireid) == mp and str(damid) == mp:
01332             _compl = 0.0
01333         else:
01334             # Use pyp_nrm/recurse_pedigree_n()...
01335             _sire_ped = []
01336             n_max_ancestors = 2 * ( ( 2 ** gens ) - 1 )
01337             _sire_ped = pyp_nrm.recurse_pedigree_n(pedobj,sireid,_sire_ped,gens-1)
01338             _l_sire_ped = len(_sire_ped)
01339             #print '\tLen sire ped: ', len(_sire_ped)#, _sire_ped
01340             _dam_ped = []
01341             _dam_ped = pyp_nrm.recurse_pedigree_n(pedobj,damid,_dam_ped,gens-1)
01342             _l_dam_ped = len(_dam_ped)
01343             #print '\tLen dam ped: ', len(_dam_ped)#, _dam_ped
01344             #print '\tMax ancestors: ', n_max_ancestors
01345             _compl = float( _l_sire_ped + _l_dam_ped ) / float( n_max_ancestors )
01346         #if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
01347         #print '\tPedigree completeness: %s' % (_compl)
01348         pedobj.pedigree[i].pedcomp = _compl
01349 
01350         # Summary statistics
01351         c_sum = c_sum + _compl
01352         c_cnt = c_cnt + 1
01353         if _compl > c_max:
01354             c_max = _compl
01355         if _compl < c_min:
01356             c_min = _compl
01357 
01358         c_summary['sum'] = c_sum
01359         c_summary['n'] = c_cnt
01360         c_summary['min'] = c_min
01361         c_summary['max'] = c_max
01362         c_rng = c_max - c_min
01363         c_summary['range'] = c_rng
01364         c_avg = float(c_sum) / float(c_cnt)
01365         c_summary['average'] = c_avg
01366 
01367         # Non-founder summary stats
01368         if pedobj.pedigree[i].founder != 'y':
01369             nf_c_sum = nf_c_sum + _compl
01370             nf_c_cnt = nf_c_cnt + 1
01371             if _compl > nf_c_max:
01372                     nf_c_max = _compl
01373             if _compl < nf_c_min:
01374                     nf_c_min = _compl
01375 
01376     c_summary['nonfounder_sum'] = nf_c_sum
01377     c_summary['nonfounder_n'] = nf_c_cnt
01378     c_summary['nonfounder_min'] = nf_c_min
01379     c_summary['nonfounder_max'] = nf_c_max
01380     nf_c_rng = nf_c_max - nf_c_min
01381     c_summary['nonfounder_range'] = nf_c_rng
01382     nf_c_avg = float(nf_c_sum) / float(nf_c_cnt)
01383     c_summary['nonfounder_average'] = nf_c_avg
01384 
01385     if pedobj.kw['messages'] == 'verbose':
01386         print '-'*80
01387         print 'Pedigree completeness summary statistics (all animals):'
01388         print '\tN\t%s' % (c_cnt)
01389         print '\tSum\t%s' % (c_sum)
01390         print '\tMean\t%s' % (c_avg)
01391         print '\tMin\t%s' % (c_min)
01392         print '\tMax\t%s' % (c_max)
01393         print '\tRange\t%s' % (c_rng)
01394         print '-'*80
01395         print 'Pedigree completeness summary statistics (non-founders):'
01396         print '\tN\t%s' % (nf_c_cnt)
01397         print '\tSum\t%s' % (nf_c_sum)
01398         print '\tMean\t%s' % (nf_c_avg)
01399         print '\tMin\t%s' % (nf_c_min)
01400         print '\tMax\t%s' % (nf_c_max)
01401         print '\tRange\t%s' % (nf_c_rng)
01402         print '-'*80
01403 
01404     try: logging.info('Exited pedigree_completeness()')
01405     except: pass
01406     return c_summary
01407 
01408 ##
01409 # common_ancestors() returns a list of the ancestors that two animals share in common.
01410 # @param anim_a The renumbered ID of the first animal, a.
01411 # @param anim_b The renumbered ID of the second animal, b.
01412 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
01413 # @retval A list of animals related to anim_a AND anim_b
01414 def common_ancestors(anim_a, anim_b, pedobj):
01415     """
01416     common_ancestors() returns a list of the ancestors that two animals share in common.
01417     """
01418     #try: logging.info('Entered common_ancestors()')
01419     #except: pass
01420     #print anim_a
01421     #print anim_b
01422     ped_a = related_animals(anim_a,pedobj)
01423     #print 'ped_a %s: %s' % ( anim_a, ped_a )
01424     ped_b = related_animals(anim_b,pedobj)
01425     #print 'ped_b %s: %s' % ( anim_b, ped_b )
01426     shared = []
01427     try:
01428         ped_a.sort()
01429         ped_b.sort()
01430         # I know that this is a bad way to do this!
01431         for _a in ped_a:
01432             if _a in ped_b:
01433                 shared.append(_a)
01434     except:
01435         pass
01436 
01437     #try: logging.info('Exited common_ancestors()')
01438     #except: pass
01439     return shared
01440 
01441 ##
01442 # related_animals() returns a list of the ancestors of an animal.
01443 # @param anim The renumbered ID of an animal, a.
01444 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
01445 # @retval A list of animals related to anim_a
01446 def related_animals(anim, pedobj):
01447     """
01448     related_animals() returns a list of the ancestors of an animal.
01449     """
01450     # Use dictionaries for the lookups!
01451     #try: logging.info('Entered related_animals()')
01452     #except: pass
01453     _ped = []
01454     try:
01455         _ped = pyp_nrm.recurse_pedigree_idonly(pedobj,anim,_ped)
01456     except:
01457         pass
01458     #try: logging.info('Exited related_animals()')
01459     #except: pass
01460     #print '_ped %s: %s' % ( anim, _ped )
01461     return _ped
01462 
01463 ##
01464 # relationship() returns the coefficient of relationship for two
01465 # animals, anim_a and anim_b.
01466 # @param anim_a The renumbered ID of an animal, a.
01467 # @param anim_b The renumbered ID of an animal, b.
01468 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
01469 # @param renumber Renumber the pedigree if it has not yet been renumbered.
01470 # @retval The coefficient of relationship of anim_a and anim_b
01471 def relationship(anim_a, anim_b, pedobj, renumber=False):
01472     """
01473     relationship() returns the coefficient of relationship for two
01474     animals, anim_a and anim_b.
01475     """
01476     if pedobj.kw['pedigree_is_renumbered'] == 0 and renumber == False:
01477         if pedobj.kw['messages'] != 'quiet':
01478             print '[WARNING]: The pedigree you passed to pyp_metrics/relationship() is not renumbered; this may result in incorrect calculations!'
01479         try: logging.warning('The pedigree you passed to pyp_metrics/relationship() is not renumbered; this may result in incorrect calculations!')
01480         except: pass
01481     elif pedobj.kw['pedigree_is_renumbered'] == 0 and renumber == True:
01482         if pedobj.kw['messages'] != 'quiet':
01483             print '[INFO]: Renumbering the pedigree in pyp_metrics/relationship().'
01484         try: logging.info('Renumbering the pedigree in pyp_metrics/relationship().')
01485         except: pass
01486         pedobj.kw['renumber'] = 1
01487         pedobj.renumber()
01488     else:
01489         pass
01490     _r = 0.0                                                # This is the default
01491     if anim_a == anim_b:
01492         _r = 1.0
01493     else:
01494         # If there is an NRM attached to the pedigree then use it.
01495         try:
01496             if pedobj.kw['form_nrm'] and pedobj.nrm.nrm.shape[0] == pedobj.metadata.num_records:
01497                 _r = pedobj.nrm.nrm[int(anim_a)-1][int(anim_b)-1]
01498         # If the NRM lookup fails go ahead and calculate the relationship the long way.
01499         except:
01500             # Extract the pedigree for each animal, merge the two, and
01501             # compute the coefficient of relationship.
01502             try:
01503                 # This is not very efficient, but let's get the bugs fixed
01504                 # before we tty anything fancy.
01505                 _ped_a, _ped_b, _ped, _seen = [], [], [], {}
01506                 _ped_a = pyp_nrm.recurse_pedigree(pedobj,anim_a,_ped_a)
01507                 _ped_b = pyp_nrm.recurse_pedigree(pedobj,anim_b,_ped_b)
01508                 # The dictionary _ped_a tracks "seen" animals
01509                 for _a in _ped_a:
01510                     try:
01511                         _seen[_a.animalID]
01512                     except KeyError:
01513                         _ped.append(_a)
01514                         _seen[_a.animalID] = _a.animalID
01515                 for _b in _ped_b:
01516                     try:
01517                         _seen[_b.animalID]
01518                     except KeyError:
01519                         _ped.append(_b)
01520                         _seen[_b.animalID] = _b.animalID
01521                 del(_ped_a)
01522                 del(_ped_b)
01523                 _tag = '%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'])
01524                 _reord = []
01525                 for j in range(len(_ped)):
01526                     _reord.append(copy.copy(_ped[j-1]))
01527                 if pedobj.kw['slow_reorder']:
01528                     _reord = pyp_utils.reorder(_reord,_tag,debug=pedobj.kw['debug_messages'])
01529                 else:
01530                     _reord = pyp_utils.fast_reorder(_reord,_tag)
01531                 _s, _map = pyp_utils.renumber(_reord,_tag, returnmap=1, \
01532                     debug=pedobj.kw['debug_messages'])
01533                 _backmap = {}
01534                 for _mk, _mv in _map.iteritems():
01535                     _backmap[_mv] = _mk
01536                 _opts = copy.copy(pedobj.kw)
01537                 _opts['filetag'] = _tag
01538                 if pedobj.kw['nrm_method'] == 'nrm':
01539                     _a = pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix(_s,_opts)
01540                 else:
01541                     _a = pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix_r(_s,_opts)
01542                 _r = _a[_map[anim_a]-1][_map[anim_b]-1]
01543             # If we can't calculate the relationship for some reason return a 0.
01544             except:
01545                 try: logging.warn('Could not compute the relationship between animals %s and %s; defaulting to 0.0', anim_a, anim_b)
01546                 except: pass
01547     return _r
01548 
01549 ##
01550 # mating_coi() returns the coefficient of inbreeding of offspring of a
01551 # mating between two animals, anim_a and anim_b.
01552 # @param anim_a The renumbered ID of an animal, a.
01553 # @param anim_b The renumbered ID of an animal, b.
01554 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
01555 # @param gens The number of generations from the pedigree to be used for calculating CoI.  By default, gens=0.
01556 # @retval The coefficient of inbreeding of the offpsring of anim_a and anim_b
01557 def mating_coi(anim_a, anim_b, pedobj, gens=0):
01558     """
01559     mating_coi() returns the coefficient of inbreeding of offspring of a
01560     mating between two animals, anim_a and anim_b.
01561     """
01562     try: logging.info('Entered mating_coi()')
01563     except: pass
01564     gens = int(gens)
01565     _f = -999.9
01566     #print 'gens: %d' % ( gens )
01567     if anim_a == anim_b:
01568         _f =  1.0
01569     else:
01570         # This is the original method that does not require than an animal
01571         # be added to, and then deleted from, the pedigree.
01572         if gens == -1:
01573             try:
01574                 # This is simple -- the CoI of an animal is one-half of the
01575                 # relationship between sire and dam.
01576                 _r = relationship(anim_a,anim_b,pedobj)
01577                 _f = 0.5 * _r
01578             except:
01579                 _f = 0.0
01580         # This is the new (as of 04/10/2006) method that uses a new dummy
01581         # animal in the pedigree.
01582         elif gens >= 0:
01583             try: logging.warning('Using the new algorithm in pyp_metrics/mating_coi().')
01584             except: pass
01585             #print 'Using the new algorithm in pyp_metrics/mating_coi().'
01586             # Add the hypothetical animal to the pedigree.
01587             _newid = max(pedobj.idmap.keys())+1
01588             #print '_newid: ', _newid
01589             #print 'ID: ', pedobj.pedigree[-1].animalID, '\tName: ', \
01590                 #pedobj.pedigree[-1].name, '\tSire:', pedobj.pedigree[-1].sireName, \
01591                 #'\tDam:', pedobj.pedigree[-1].damName
01592             _added = pedobj.addanimal(_newid,anim_a,anim_b)
01593             #print '_added: ', _added
01594             #print pedobj.pedigree[-1].animalID, pedobj.pedigree[-1].name
01595             if _added:
01596                 # Most of this code was lifted verbatim from
01597                 # pyp_nrm/inbreeding_vanraden(). That's where you
01598                 # should look for insight and commentary.
01599                 #print '\tConverting pedigree to graph.'
01600                 ng = pyp_network.ped_to_graph(pedobj)
01601                 _ped, top_ped = [], []
01602                 # If gens > 0 then we need to limit the pedigree to
01603                 # that number of generations.
01604                 if int(gens) > 0:
01605                     top_peddict = pyp_network.find_ancestors_g(ng, len(pedobj.idmap), {}, gens)
01606                     top_peddict[len(pedobj.idmap)] = 1
01607                     top_ped = top_peddict.keys()
01608                     top_r, _anids = [], []
01609                     for _j in top_ped:
01610                         if top_peddict[_j] <= gens:
01611                             top_r.append(copy.copy(pedobj.pedigree[int(_j)-1]))
01612                             if top_peddict[_j] == 1:
01613                                 top_r[-1].sireID = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']
01614                                 top_r[-1].damID = pedobj.kw['missing_parent']
01615                             _anids.append(top_r[-1].animalID)
01616                 else:
01617                     _anids = pedobj.backmap.keys()
01618                 #print _anids
01619                 # Now we need to actually build the subpedigree for
01620                 # the hypothetical animal.
01621                 if int(gens) > 0:
01622                     _ped = top_peddict
01623                 else:
01624                     #pedobj.pedigree[-1].printme()
01625                     #print '\t\tFinding ancestors of %s.' % \
01626                         #( pedobj.pedigree[-1].animalID )
01627                     _ped = pyp_network.find_ancestors(ng, \
01628                         pedobj.pedigree[-1].animalID, [])
01629                     _ped.append(int(pedobj.pedigree[-1].animalID))
01630                     #print _ped
01631                     #print '\t\tThe pedigree for animal %s (orig ID: %s) has %s entries.' % ( pedobj.pedigree[-1].animalID, \
01632                         #pedobj.pedigree[-1].originalID, len(_ped))
01633                 if int(gens) > 0:
01634                     _r = top_r
01635                 else:
01636                     _r = []
01637                     _map = {}
01638                     #print '\t\tCopying pedigree for %s.' % ( pedobj.pedigree[-1].originalID )
01639                     for j in _ped:
01640                         _r.append(copy.copy(pedobj.pedigree[int(j)-1]))
01641                 #print '\t\tReordering pedigree for %s.' % ( pedobj.pedigree[-1].animalID )
01642                 _tag = '%s_%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],pedobj.pedigree[-1].animalID)
01643                 if pedobj.kw['slow_reorder']:
01644                     _r = pyp_utils.reorder(_r,_tag)
01645                 else:
01646                     _r = pyp_utils.fast_reorder(_r,_tag)
01647                 #print '\t\tRenumbering pedigree for %s.' % ( pedobj.pedigree[-1].animalID )
01648                 _s, _map = pyp_utils.renumber(_r,_tag, returnmap=1, debug=pedobj.kw['debug_messages'])
01649                 _backmap = {}
01650                 for _mk, _mv in _map.iteritems():
01651                     _backmap[_mv] = _mk
01652                 _opts = copy.copy(pedobj.kw)
01653                 _opts['filetag'] = _tag
01654                 #print '\t\tForming the A matrix for %s\'s pedigree.' % ( pedobj.pedigree[-1].animalID )
01655                 if pedobj.kw['nrm_method'] == 'nrm':
01656                     _a = pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix(_s,_opts)
01657                 else:
01658                     _a = pyp_nrm.fast_a_matrix_r(_s,_opts)
01659                 #print _map
01660                 #print _a
01661                 _f = _a[_map[pedobj.pedigree[-1].animalID]-1][_map[pedobj.pedigree[-1].animalID]-1] - 1.
