01662                 #print '_r: ', _r
01663                 #print '_f: ', _f
01664                 # Cleanup
01665                 del(_r); del(_map); del(_backmap); del(_a)
01666                 del(_s); del(ng); del(_ped); del(top_ped)
01667                 try: del(top_peddict)
01668                 except: pass
01669                 try: del(top_r)
01670                 except: pass
01671                 try: del(anids)
01672                 except: pass
01673                 # Now that we're done, delete the hypothetical animal
01674                 # from the pedigree.
01675                 pedobj.delanimal(_newid)
01676         else:
01677             pass
01678     try: logging.info('Exited mating_coi()')
01679     except: pass
01680     return _f
01681 
01682 ##
01683 # mating_coi_group() returns the coefficients of inbreeding of offspring
01684 # of a series of matings, as well as a list of minimum-inbreeding matings.
01685 # @param matings A list of proposed matings
01686 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
01687 # @param names Indicates if the identifiers in 'matings' are names or animalIDs
01688 # @param gens The number of generations from the pedigree to be used for calculating CoI.  By default, gens=0.
01689 # @retval The coefficient of inbreeding of the offpsring of anim_a and anim_b
01690 def mating_coi_group(matings, pedobj, names=0, gens=0):
01691     _results = {}
01692     fx = {}
01693     metadata = {}
01694     matingf = {}
01695     try:
01696         if names == 1:
01697             _matings = []
01698             for m in matings:
01699                 msplit = m.split('_')
01700                 # Note that we need to map from names to original IDs
01701                 # and from original IDs to renumbered IDs
01702                 _matings[pedobj.namemap[k]] = pedobj.namemap[v]
01703                 _matings.append('%s_%s'%(pedobj.namemap[msplit[0]], pedobj.namemap[msplit[1]]))
01704         else:
01705             _matings = matings
01706         #if pedobj.kw['messages'] == 'verbose':
01707             #print 'S\tD\tf'
01708 
01709         f_min=1.;f_max=-1.;f_mean=0.;f_range=0.;f_sum=0.;f_n = 0.
01710         f_min_nz=1.;f_max_nz=-1.;f_mean_nz=0.;f_range_nz=0.;f_sum_nz=0.;f_n_nz=0.
01711 
01712         #for k,v in _matings.iteritems():
01713         for m in matings:
01714             msplit = m.split('_')
01715             k = msplit[0]
01716             v = msplit[1]
01717             if not fx.has_key(k): fx[k] = {}
01718             coi = mating_coi(k,v,pedobj,gens)
01719             fx[k][v] = coi
01720             # Accumulate summary statistics
01721             f_sum = f_sum + coi
01722             f_n = f_n + 1
01723             if coi < f_min: f_min = coi
01724             if coi > f_max: f_max = coi
01725             # Stats for non-zero CoI
01726             if coi > 0.:
01727                 f_sum_nz = f_sum_nz + coi
01728                 f_n_nz = f_n_nz + 1
01729                 if coi < f_min_nz: f_min_nz = coi
01730                 if coi > f_max_nz: f_max_nz = coi
01731             #if pedobj.kw['messages'] == 'verbose':
01732                 #if names == 1:
01733                     #print pedobj.namebackmap[k], '\t', pedobj.namebackmap[v], \
01734                         #'\t', coi
01735                 #else:
01736                     #print k, '\t', v, '\t', coi
01737             matingf[m] = coi
01738         f_range = f_max - f_min
01739         f_range_nz = f_max_nz - f_min_nz
01740         try: f_mean = f_sum / f_n
01741         except: f_mean = 0.
01742         try: f_mean_nz = f_sum_nz / f_n_nz
01743         except: f_mean_nz = 0.
01744         # Summary statistics including all CoI
01745         metadata['all'] = {}
01746         metadata['all']['f_n'] = f_n
01747         metadata['all']['f_sum'] = f_sum
01748         metadata['all']['f_min'] = f_min
01749         metadata['all']['f_max'] = f_max
01750         metadata['all']['f_range'] = f_range
01751         metadata['all']['f_mean'] = f_mean
01752         # Summary statistics including only nonzero CoI
01753         metadata['nonzero'] = {}
01754         metadata['nonzero']['f_n'] = f_n_nz
01755         metadata['nonzero']['f_sum'] = f_sum_nz
01756         metadata['nonzero']['f_min'] = f_min_nz
01757         metadata['nonzero']['f_max'] = f_max_nz
01758         metadata['nonzero']['f_range'] = f_range_nz
01759         metadata['nonzero']['f_mean'] = f_mean_nz
01760         _results['metadata'] = metadata
01761         #_results['fx'] = fx
01762         _results['matings'] = matingf
01763         #print '_results: ', _results
01764     except:
01765         pass
01766     return _results
01767 
01768 ##
01769 # effective_founder_genomes() simulates the random segregation of founder alleles through a pedigree.
01770 # At present only two alleles are simulated for each founder.  Summary statistics are
01771 # computed on the most recent generation.
01772 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
01773 # @param rounds The number of times to simulate segregation through the entire pedigree.
01774 # @param chrometype The type of chromosome to simulate ('autosome'|'sex').
01775 # @param heterogametic The heterogametic sex in your species ('f'|'m').
01776 # @param quiet If False output is shown; if True output is not shown.
01777 # @retval The effective number of founder genomes based on 'rounds' of gene-drop simulations.
01778 def effective_founder_genomes(pedobj, rounds=10, chrometype='autosome', heterogametic='m', quiet=False):
01779     """
01780     effective_founder_genomes() simulates the random segregation of founder alleles
01781     through a pedigree.  At present only two alleles are simulated for each founder.
01782     Summary statistics are computed on the most recent generation.
01783     """
01784     logging.info('Entered effective_founder_genomes()')
01785     #except: pass
01786     #print '[DEBUG]: rounds: %s' % ( rounds )
01787     if rounds < 1:
01788         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
01789             print '[ERROR]: The rounds parameter in pyp_metrics/gene_drop() must be positive (>0)!'
01790         rounds = 1
01791     # Check chrometype values for validity; default to 'autosome'
01792     if chrometype not in ['autosome','sex']:
01793         try: logging.warning('You provided an unrecognized value of the chrometype parameter, %s, in effective_founder_genomes(); defaulting to \'autosome\'',chrometype)
01794         except: pass
01795         chrometype = 'autosome'
01796     # Check heterogametic sex; default to 'm'ale  as do mammals
01797     if heterogametic not in ['m','f']:
01798         try: logging.warning('You provided an unrecognized value of the heterogametic parameter, %s, in effective_founder_genomes(); defaulting to \'m\'',heterogametic)
01799         except: pass
01800         heterogametic = 'm'
01801     # Build a list of generations
01802     l = len(pedobj.pedigree)
01803     # Build a list of unique generations so that we can find the most recent generation
01804     gens = []       # list of generation IDs in the pedigree
01805     ngen = 0    # Number of animals in the latest generation
01806     nfounders = 0
01807     n_g = 0.0   # Effective number of founder genomes
01808     for j in range(l):
01809         g = pedobj.pedigree[j].gen
01810         if g in gens:
01811             pass
01812         else:
01813             gens.append(g)
01814         if pedobj.pedigree[j].founder == 'y':
01815             nfounders = nfounders + 1
01816     gens.sort()
01817     allele_freqs = {}
01818     summary_freqs = {}
01819     summary_freqs['distinct_alleles'] = {}
01820     summary_stats = {}
01821     summary_stats['distinct_alleles'] = {}
01822     outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_gene_drop','.out')
01823     myline = '='*80
01824     myline2 = '*'*80
01825     for r in xrange(rounds):
01826         #print '[DEBUG]: Round %s in effextive_founder_genomes()' % ( r )
01827         random.seed()
01828         allele_freqs = {}
01829         for i in range(l):
01830             if pedobj.pedigree[i].founder == 'y':
01831                 if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
01832                     print '[DEBUG]: Alleles for founder %s:\t%s' % (pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID,pedobj.pedigree[i].alleles)
01833             else:
01834                 _error = 0
01835                 if pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID)-1].alleles == ['','']:
01836                     if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
01837                         print '[ERROR]: The sire (%s) of animal %s does not have usable alleles: %s!' % (pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID,pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID,pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID)-1].alleles)
01838                     _error = 1
01839                 if pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].damID)-1].alleles == ['','']:
01840                     if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
01841                         print '[ERROR]: The dam (%s) of animal %s does not have usable alleles: %s!' % (pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID,pedobj.pedigree[i].damID,pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].damID)-1].alleles)
01842                     _error = 1
01843                 if _error == 1:
01844                     return 0
01845                 # Pick a sire allele at random
01846                 #random.seed(random.randint(1,1000000000))
01847                 random.seed()
01848                 _rs = random.random()
01849                 if _rs < 0.5:
01850                     _as = pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID)-1].alleles[0]
01851                 else:
01852                     _as = pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID)-1].alleles[1]
01853                 # Pick a dam allele at random
01854                 #random.seed(random.randint(1,1000000000))
01855                 random.seed()
01856                 _rd = random.random()
01857                 if _rd < 0.5:
01858                     _ad = pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].damID)-1].alleles[0]
01859                 else:
01860                     _ad = pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].damID)-1].alleles[1]
01861                 if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
01862                     print '[DEBUG]: Animal %s (g: %s) (s:%s,d:%s) got sire allele %s and dam allele %s' % (pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID,pedobj.pedigree[i].gen,pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID,pedobj.pedigree[i].damID,_as,_ad)
01863                 pedobj.pedigree[i].alleles = [_as,_ad]
01864                 if pedobj.pedigree[i].gen == gens[-1:][0]:
01865                     try:
01866                         allele_freqs[pedobj.pedigree[i].alleles[0]] = allele_freqs[pedobj.pedigree[i].alleles[0]] + 1
01867                     except KeyError:
01868                         allele_freqs[pedobj.pedigree[i].alleles[0]] = 1
01869                     try:
01870                         allele_freqs[pedobj.pedigree[i].alleles[1]] = allele_freqs[pedobj.pedigree[i].alleles[1]] + 1
01871                     except KeyError:
01872                         allele_freqs[pedobj.pedigree[i].alleles[1]] = 1
01873                     #print '[DEBUG]: Animal %s (g: %s) (s:%s,d:%s) got sire allele %s and dam allele %s' % (pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID,pedobj.pedigree[i].gen,pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID,pedobj.pedigree[i].damID,_as,_ad)
01874         # Sumamarize allele data
01875         nalleles = len(allele_freqs.keys()) # Number of distinct alleles in latest generation
01876         allelecount = 0
01877         for k in allele_freqs.keys():
01878             allelecount = allelecount + int(allele_freqs[k])
01879         _ngs = 0.0
01880         for k in allele_freqs.keys():
01881             _freq = float(allele_freqs[k]) / float(allelecount)
01882             _ngs = _ngs + _freq**2
01883         _ng = 1. / (2.*_ngs)
01884 
01885         # Update summary dictionary
01886         try:
01887             summary_freqs['allele_count'] = summary_freqs['allele_count'] + allelecount
01888         except KeyError:
01889             summary_freqs['allele_count'] = allelecount
01890         try:
01891             summary_freqs['distinct_allele_count'] = summary_freqs['distinct_allele_count'] + nalleles
01892         except KeyError:
01893             summary_freqs['distinct_allele_count'] = nalleles
01894         for k in allele_freqs.keys():
01895             try:
01896                 summary_freqs['distinct_alleles'][k] = summary_freqs['distinct_alleles'][k] + allele_freqs[k]
01897             except KeyError:
01898                 summary_freqs['distinct_alleles'][k] = allele_freqs[k]
01899         try:
01900             summary_freqs['n_g'] = ( _ng + summary_freqs['n_g'] ) / 2.
01901         except KeyError:
01902             summary_freqs['n_g'] = _ng
01903 
01904         # Handle writing the output file
01905         if r == 0:
01906             dout = open(outputfile,'w')
01907             mname = '# FILE: %s\n' % (outputfile)
01908             dout.write(mname)
01909             dout.write('# Results from %s-round PyPedal gene-drop simulation.\n'%(rounds))
01910         else:
01911             dout = open(outputfile,'a')
01912         dout.write('%s\n'%(myline))
01913         dout.write('Allele frequency data from gene drop simulation, round %s\n' % (r+1))
01914         dout.write('\tNumber of distinct alleles: %s\n' % (nalleles))
01915         allelecount = 0
01916         for k in allele_freqs.keys():
01917             allelecount = allelecount + int(allele_freqs[k])
01918         dout.write('\tNumber of alleles in latest generation: %s\n' % (allelecount))
01919         _ngs = 0.0
01920         for k in allele_freqs.keys():
01921             _freq = float(allele_freqs[k]) / float(allelecount)
01922             dout.write('\t\tAllele %s:\t%s (%s)\n' % (k,_freq,_freq**2))
01923             _ngs = _ngs + _freq**2
01924         _ng = 1. / (2.*_ngs)
01925         dout.write('\tEffective number of founder genomes: %s\n' % (_ng))
01926         dout.close()
01927 
01928     # Compute summary stats from summary dictionary
01929     summary_stats['allele_count'] = float(summary_freqs['allele_count']) / float(rounds)
01930     summary_stats['distinct_allele_count'] = float(summary_freqs['distinct_allele_count']) / float(rounds)
01931     summary_stats['freq_sum'] = 0.0
01932     for k in summary_freqs['distinct_alleles'].keys():
01933         summary_stats['freq_sum'] = summary_stats['freq_sum'] + summary_freqs['distinct_alleles'][k]
01934     for k in summary_freqs['distinct_alleles'].keys():
01935         summary_stats['distinct_alleles'][k] = summary_freqs['distinct_alleles'][k] / float(summary_stats['freq_sum'])
01936     summary_stats['n_g'] = summary_freqs['n_g']
01937 
01938     # Print summary statistics to screen at the end of the last round
01939     if pedobj.kw['messages'] == 'verbose'  and quiet == False:
01940         print '*'*100
01941         print 'Summary statistics from %s-round gene-drop simulation' % (rounds)
01942         print '\tNumber of distinct founder alleles: %s' % (2*nfounders)
01943         print '\tMean allele count in latest generation: %s' % (summary_stats['allele_count'])
01944         print '\tMean number of distinct alleles in latest generation: %s' % (summary_stats['distinct_allele_count'])
01945         print '\tFrequency of distinct alleles sampled:'
01946         for k in summary_stats['distinct_alleles'].keys():
01947             print '\t\tAllele %s:\t%s (%s)' % (k,summary_stats['distinct_alleles'][k],summary_stats['distinct_alleles'][k]**2)
01948         print '\tMean effective number of founder genomes: %s' % (summary_stats['n_g'])
01949         print '*'*100
01950 
01951     # Write summary statistics to the output file at the end of the last round.
01952     dout = open(outputfile,'a')
01953     dout.write('%s\n'%(myline2))
01954     dout.write('Summary statistics from %s-round gene-drop simulation\n' % (rounds))
01955     dout.write('\tNumber of distinct founder alleles: %s\n' % (2*nfounders))
01956     dout.write('\tMean allele count in latest generation: %s\n' % (summary_stats['allele_count']))
01957     dout.write('\tMean number of distinct alleles in latest generation: %s\n' % (summary_stats['distinct_allele_count']))
01958     dout.write('\tFrequency of distinct alleles sampled:\n')
01959     for k in summary_stats['distinct_alleles'].keys():
01960         dout.write('\t\tAllele %s:\t%s (%s)\n' % (k,summary_stats['distinct_alleles'][k],summary_stats['distinct_alleles'][k]**2))
01961     dout.write('\tMean effective number of founder genomes: %s\n'%(summary_stats['n_g']))
01962     dout.close()
01963 
01964     try: logging.info('Exited effective_founder_genomes()')
01965     except: pass
01966     return summary_stats['n_g']
01967 
01968 ##
01969 # generation_intervals() computes the average age of parents at the time of
01970 # birth of their first (oldest) offspring.  This is implies that selection
01971 # decisions are made at the time of birth of the first offspring.  Average
01972 # ages are computed for each of four paths: sire-son, sire-daughter, dam-son,
01973 # and dam-daughter.  An overall mean is computed, as well.  IT IS IMPORTANT
01974 # to note that if you DO NOT provide birthyears in your pedigree file that the
01975 # returned dictionary will contain only zeroes!  This is because when no birthyear
01976 # is provided a default value (1900) is assigned to all animals in the pedigree.
01977 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
01978 # @param units A character indicating the units in which the generation lengths should be returned.
01979 # @retval A dictionary containing the five average ages.
01980 def generation_intervals(pedobj, units='y'):
01981     """
01982     generation_intervals() computes the average age of parents at the time of
01983     birth of their first (oldest) offspring.  This is implies that selection
01984     decisions are made at the time of birth of the first offspring.  Average
01985     ages are computed for each of four paths: sire-son, sire-daughter, dam-son,
01986     and dam-daughter.  An overall mean is computed, as well.  IT IS IMPORTANT
01987     to note that if you DO NOT provide birthyears in your pedigree file that the
01988     returned dictionary will contain only zeroes!  This is because when no birthyear
01989     is provided a default value (1900) is assigned to all animals in the pedigree.
01990     """
01991     try: logging.info('Entered generation_intervals()')
01992     except: pass
01993     _sire_son = {}
01994     _sire_dau = {}
01995     _dam_son = {}
01996     _dam_dau = {}
01997     _n_unks = 0
01998 
01999     if not pedobj.kw['set_offspring']:
02000         pyp_utils.assign_offspring(pedobj)
02001         pedobj.kw['set_offspring'] = 1
02002 
02003     for m in pedobj.pedigree:
02004         #print m.sex
02005         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02006             if len(m.sons) > 0 or len(m.daus) > 0:
02007                 print 'Animal %s has sex %s' % (m.animalID,m.sex)
02008         if m.sex == 'u' or m.sex == 'U':
02009             _n_unks = _n_unks + 1
02010         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02011             print '\tAnimal: %s (%s)' % (m.animalID, m.originalID)
02012             print '\t\tsons: %s' % (m.sons)
02013             print '\t\tdaus: %s' % (m.daus)
02014         _by = m.by
02015         _oldestson = -999
02016         _oldestdau = -999
02017         #
02018         # Walk through the sons list for this animal and use the birthyear attribute
02019         # to assign the oldest son to _oldestson.  If more than one son has the same
02020         # age then keep the first-seen son as the oldest.  It does not matter which we
02021         # keep for the computation; keeping the first is simply the easiest thing to
02022         # do.
02023         #
02024         if len(m.sons) > 0:
02025             if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02026                 print '\tAnimal %s sons: %s' % (m.animalID,m.sons)
02027             for s in m.sons:
02028                 s = int(s)
02029                 if _oldestson == -999:
02030                     _oldestson = int(s)
02031                 elif int(pedobj.pedigree[s-1].by)  < int(pedobj.pedigree[_oldestson-1].by):
02032                     _oldestson = int(s)
02033                 else:
02034                     pass
02035         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02036             print '\t\t_oldestson: %s' % (_oldestson)
02037         #
02038         # Walk through the daus list for this animal and use the birthyear attribute
02039         # to assign the oldest dau to _oldestdau.  If more than one dau has the same
02040         # age then keep the first-seen dau as the oldest.  It does not matter which we
02041         # keep for the computation; keeping the first is simply the easiest thing to
02042         # do.
02043         #
02044         if len(m.daus) > 0:
02045             if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02046                 print '\tAnimal %s daus: %s' % (m.animalID,m.daus)
02047             for d in m.daus:
02048                 d = int(d)
02049                 if _oldestdau == -999:
02050                     _oldestdau = int(d)
02051                 elif pedobj.pedigree[d-1].by  < pedobj.pedigree[_oldestdau-1].by:
02052                     _oldestdau = int(d)
02053                 else:
02054                     pass
02055         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02056             print '\t\t_oldestdau: %s' % (_oldestdau)
02057         #
02058         # This is where we assign sons and daus to one of the four selection paths:
02059         # sire-son, dam-son, sire-daughter, and dam-daughter.
02060         #
02061         # If the animal is a sire and has offspring, he contributes paths to the
02062         # sire-son and sire-daughter dictionaries.
02063         if m.sex == 'm':
02064             if _oldestson != -999:
02065                 if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02066                     print '\tAdding sire-son pair %s-%s to _sire_son[]' % (m.animalID,_oldestson)
02067                 _sire_son[m.animalID] = _oldestson
02068             if _oldestdau != -999:
02069                 if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02070                     print '\tAdding sire-dau pair %s-%s to _sire_dau[]' % (m.animalID,_oldestdau)
02071                 _sire_dau[m.animalID] = _oldestdau
02072         # If the animal is a dam and has offspring, she contributes paths to the
02073         # dam-son and dam-daughter dictionaries.
02074         elif m.sex == 'f':
02075             if _oldestson != -999:
02076                 if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02077                     print '\tAdding dam-son pair %s-%s to _dam_son[]' % (m.animalID,_oldestson)
02078                 _dam_son[m.animalID] = _oldestson
02079             if _oldestdau != -999:
02080                 if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02081                     print '\tAdding dam-dau pair %s-%s to _dam_dau[]' % (m.animalID,_oldestdau)
02082                 _dam_dau[m.animalID] = _oldestdau
02083         else:
02084             pass
02085 
02086     if pedobj.kw['messages'] == 'verbose':
02087         if _n_unks > 0:
02088             print '\t[MESSAGE]: %s of %s animals in the pedigree were of unknown sex and were excluded from calculations.' \
02089                 % (_n_unks,len(pedobj.pedigree))
02090         print '\tPaths:'
02091         print '\t\tSire-Son: %s' % (_sire_son)
02092         print '\t\tSire-Dau: %s' % (_sire_dau)
02093         print '\t\tDam-Son: %s' % (_dam_son)
02094         print '\t\tDam-Dau: %s' % (_dam_dau)
02095 
02096     #
02097     # Now that we have four dictionaries with the parent-offspring pathways
02098     # corresponding to the births of oldest offspring we need to compute the
02099     # actual generation lengths.  For now, we are going to compute them in years.
02100     # If you are a mouse or fly person, you may not get the answers that you are
02101     # expecting here.
02102     #
02103     _ssy = 0.
02104     _sdy = 0.
02105     _dsy = 0.
02106     _ddy = 0.
02107     _overall = 0.
02108     try:
02109         # For each path in the sire-son dictionary compute the difference between
02110         # the son's year of birth and the sire's year of birth.  Add that difference
02111         # to an accumulator.
02112         for k,v in _sire_son.iteritems():
02113             #print 'Son %s\'s birthyear: %s' % ( v, int(pedobj.pedigree[int(v)-1].by) )
02114             #print 'Sire %s\'s birthyear: %s' % ( k, int(pedobj.pedigree[int(k)-1].by) )
02115             _ssy = _ssy + ( int(pedobj.pedigree[int(v)-1].by) - int(pedobj.pedigree[int(k)-1].by) )
02116         _ssym = _ssy / len(_sire_son)
02117     except:
02118         _ssym = 0.
02119     try:
02120         for k,v in _sire_dau.iteritems():
02121             _sdy = _sdy + ( int(pedobj.pedigree[int(v)-1].by) - int(pedobj.pedigree[int(k)-1].by) )
02122         _sdym = _sdy / len(_sire_dau)
02123     except:
02124         _sdym = 0.
02125     try:
02126         for k,v in _dam_son.iteritems():
02127             _dsy = _dsy + ( int(pedobj.pedigree[int(v)-1].by) - int(pedobj.pedigree[int(k)-1].by) )
02128         _dsym = _dsy / len(_dam_son)
02129     except:
02130         _dsym = 0.
02131     try:
02132         for k,v in _dam_dau.iteritems():
02133             _ddy = _ddy + ( int(pedobj.pedigree[int(v)-1].by) - int(pedobj.pedigree[int(k)-1].by) )
02134         _ddym = _ddy / len(_dam_dau)
02135     except:
02136         _ddym = 0.
02137     try:
02138         _overall = ( _ssym + _sdym + _dsym + _ddym ) / 4.
02139     except:
02140         _overall = 0.
02141 
02142     _genlens = {}
02143     _genlens['ss'] = _ssym
02144     _genlens['sd'] = _sdym
02145     _genlens['ds'] = _dsym
02146     _genlens['dd'] = _ddym
02147     _genlens['mean'] = _overall
02148 
02149     if pedobj.kw['messages'] == 'verbose':
02150         print '\tMeans:'
02151         print '\t\tSire-Son: %s' % (_ssym)
02152         print '\t\tSire-Dau: %s' % (_sdym)
02153         print '\t\tDam-Son: %s' % (_dsym)
02154         print '\t\tDam-Dau: %s' % (_ddym)
02155         print '\t\tOverall: %s' % (_overall)
02156 
02157     try: logging.info('Exited generation_intervals()')
02158     except: pass
02159     return _genlens
02160 
02161 ##
02162 # generation_intervals_all() computes the average age of parents at the time of
02163 # birth of their offspring.  The computation is made using birth years for all
02164 # known offspring of sires and dams, which implies discrete generations.  Average
02165 # ages are computed for each of four paths: sire-son, sire-daughter, dam-son, and
02166 # dam-daughter.  An overall mean is computed, as well. IT IS IMPORTANT to note that
02167 # if you DO NOT provide birthyears in your pedigree file that the returned dictionary
02168 # will contain only zeroes!  This is because when no birthyear is provided a default
02169 # value (1900) is assigned to all animals in the pedigree.
02170 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
02171 # @param units A character indicating the units in which the generation lengths should be returned.
02172 # @retval A dictionary containing the five average ages.
02173 def generation_intervals_all(pedobj, units='y'):
02174     """
02175     generation_intervals_all() computes the average age of parents at the time of
02176     birth of their offspring.  The computation is made using birth years for all
02177     known offspring of sires and dams, which implies discrete generations.  Average
02178     ages are computed for each of four paths: sire-son, sire-daughter, dam-son, and
02179     dam-daughter.  An overall mean is computed, as well. IT IS IMPORTANT to note that
02180     if you DO NOT provide birthyears in your pedigree file that the returned dictionary
02181     will contain only zeroes!  This is because when no birthyear is provided a default
02182     value (1900) is assigned to all animals in the pedigree.
02183     """
02184     try: logging.info('Entered generation_intervals_all()')
02185     except: pass
02186     _sire_son = {}
02187     _sire_dau = {}
02188     _dam_son = {}
02189     _dam_dau = {}
02190     _n_unks = 0
02191 
02192     if not pedobj.kw['set_offspring']:
02193         pyp_utils.assign_offspring(pedobj)
02194         pedobj.kw['set_offspring'] = 1
02195 
02196     for m in pedobj.pedigree:
02197         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02198             m.printme()
02199             if len(m.sons) > 0 or len(m.daus) > 0:
02200                 if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02201                     print 'Animal %s has sex %s' % (m.animalID,m.sex)
02202         if m.sex == 'u' or m.sex == 'U':
02203             _n_unks = _n_unks + 1
02204         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02205             print '\tAnimal: %s' % (m.animalID)
02206             print '\t\tsons: %s' % (m.sons)
02207             print '\t\tdaus: %s' % (m.daus)
02208         #
02209         # Add dictionary entries for all dam-offspring pairs.
02210         #
02211         if m.sex == 'm':
02212             if len(m.sons) > 0:
02213                 for s in m.sons:
02214                     s = int(s)
02215                     #if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02216                     print '\tAdding sire-son pair %s-%s to _sire_son' % (m.animalID,s)
02217                     _sire_son[m.animalID] = s
02218             if len(m.daus) > 0:
02219                 for d in m.daus:
02220                     d = int(d)
02221                     #if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02222                     print '\tAdding sire-dau pair %s-%s to _sire_dau' % (m.animalID,d)
02223                     _sire_dau[m.animalID] = d
02224         #
02225         # Add dictionary entries for all dam-offspring pairs.
02226         #
02227         if m.sex == 'f':
02228             if len(m.sons) > 0:
02229                 for s in m.sons:
02230                     s = int(s)
02231                     #if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02232                     print '\tAdding sire-son pair %s-%s to _dam_son' % (m.animalID,s)
02233                     _dam_son[m.animalID] = s
02234             if len(m.daus) > 0:
02235                 for d in m.daus:
02236                     d = int(d)
02237                     #if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02238                     print '\tAdding sire-dau pair %s-%s to _dam_dau' % (m.animalID,d)
02239                     _dam_dau[m.animalID] = d
02240 
02241     if pedobj.kw['messages'] == 'verbose':
02242         if _n_unks > 0:
02243             print '\t[MESSAGE]: %s of %s animals in the pedigree were of unknown sex and were excluded from calculations.' \
02244                 % (_n_unks,len(pedobj.pedigree))
02245         print '\tPaths:'
02246         print '\t\tSire-Son: %s' % (_sire_son)
02247         print '\t\tSire-Dau: %s' % (_sire_dau)
02248         print '\t\tDam-Son: %s' % (_dam_son)
02249         print '\t\tDam-Dau: %s' % (_dam_dau)
02250 
02251     #
02252     # Now that we have four dictionaries with the parent-offspring pathways corresponding to the
02253     # births of offspring we need to compute the actual generation lengths.  For now, we are going
02254     # to compute them in years.  If you are a mouse or fly person, you may not get he answers that
02255     # you are expecting.
02256     #
02257     _ssy = 0.
02258     _sdy = 0.
02259     _dsy = 0.
02260     _ddy = 0.
02261     _overall = 0.
02262     try:
02263         for k,v in _sire_son.iteritems():
02264             _ssy = _ssy + ( int(pedobj.pedigree[int(v)-1].by) - int(pedobj.pedigree[int(k)-1].by) )
02265         _ssym = _ssy / len(_sire_son)
02266     except:
02267         _ssym = 0.
02268     try:
02269         for k,v in _sire_dau.iteritems():
02270             _sdy = _sdy + ( int(pedobj.pedigree[int(v)-1].by) - int(pedobj.pedigree[int(k)-1].by) )
02271         _sdym = _sdy / len(_sire_dau)
02272     except:
02273         _sdym = 0.
02274     try:
02275         for k,v in _dam_son.iteritems():
02276             _dsy = _dsy + ( int(pedobj.pedigree[int(v)-1].by) - int(pedobj.pedigree[int(k)-1].by) )
02277         _dsym = _dsy / len(_dam_son)
02278     except:
02279         _dsym = 0.
02280     try:
02281         for k,v in _dam_dau.iteritems():
02282             _ddy = _ddy + ( int(pedobj.pedigree[int(v)-1].by) - int(pedobj.pedigree[int(k)-1].by) )
02283         _ddym = _ddy / len(_dam_dau)
02284     except:
02285         _ddym = 0.
02286     try:
02287         _overall = ( _ssym + _sdym + _dsym + _ddym ) / 4.
02288     except:
02289         _overall = 0.
02290 
02291     _genlens = {}
02292     _genlens['ss'] = _ssym
02293     _genlens['sd'] = _sdym
02294     _genlens['ds'] = _dsym
02295     _genlens['dd'] = _ddym
02296     _genlens['mean'] = _overall
02297 
02298     if pedobj.kw['messages'] == 'verbose':
02299         print '\tMeans:'
02300         print '\t\tSire-Son: %s' % (_ssym)
02301         print '\t\tSire-Dau: %s' % (_sdym)
02302         print '\t\tDam-Son: %s' % (_dsym)
02303         print '\t\tDam-Dau: %s' % (_ddym)
02304         print '\t\tOverall: %s' % (_overall)
02305 
02306     try: logging.info('Exited generation_intervals_all()')
02307     except: pass
02308     return _genlens
02309 
02310 ##
02311 # founder_descendants() returns a dictionary containing a list of descendants of
02312 # each founder in the pedigree.
02313 # @param pedobj An instance of a PyPedal NewPedigree object.
02314 # @retval A dictionary containing a list of descendants of each founder in the pedigree.
02315 def founder_descendants(pedobj):
02316     """
02317     founder_descendants() returns a dictionary containing a list of descendants of
02318     each founder in the pedigree.
02319     """
02320     try: logging.info('Entered founder_descendants()')
02321     except: pass
02322     founder_peds = {}
02323     for f in pedobj.metadata.unique_founder_list:
02324         _desc = descendants(pedobj.idmap[f],pedobj,{})
02325         founder_peds[f] = _desc
02326     try: logging.info('Exited founder_descendants()')
02327     except: pass
02328     return founder_peds
02329 
02330 ##
02331 # descendants() uses pedigree metadata to walk a pedigree and return a list of all
02332 # of the descendants of a given animal.
02333 # @param anid An animal ID
02334 # @param pedobj A Python list of PyPedal Animal() objects.
02335 # @param _desc A Python dictionary of descendants of animal anid.
02336 # @retval A list of descendants of anid.
02337 def descendants(anid, pedobj, _desc):
02338     """
02339     descendants() uses pedigree metadata to walk a pedigree and return a list of all
02340     of the descendants of a given animal.
02341     """
02342     try: logging.info('Entered descendants()')
02343     except: pass
02344     #pedobj.pedigree[int(anid)-1].printme()
02345     #print 'unks: ', pedobj.pedigree[int(anid)-1].unks
02346     #print 'sons: ', pedobj.pedigree[int(anid)-1].sons
02347     #print 'daus: ', pedobj.pedigree[int(anid)-1].daus
02348 
02349     if len(pedobj.pedigree[int(anid)-1].unks) > 0:
02350         for _u,_v in pedobj.pedigree[int(anid)-1].unks.iteritems():
02351             try:
02352                 _utest = _desc[_u]
02353             except KeyError:
02354                 _desc[_u] = _u
02355             _desc = descendants(_u,pedobj,_desc)
02356     if len(pedobj.pedigree[int(anid)-1].sons) > 0:
02357         for _u,_v in pedobj.pedigree[int(anid)-1].sons.iteritems():
02358             try:
02359                 _utest = _desc[_u]
02360             except KeyError:
02361                 _desc[_u] = _u
02362             _desc = descendants(_u,pedobj,_desc)
02363     if len(pedobj.pedigree[int(anid)-1].daus) > 0:
02364         for _u,_v in pedobj.pedigree[int(anid)-1].daus.iteritems():
02365             try:
02366                 _utest = _desc[_u]
02367             except KeyError:
02368                 _desc[_u] = _u
02369             _desc = descendants(_u,pedobj,_desc)
02370     try: logging.info('Exited descendants()')
02371     except: pass
02372     return _desc
02373 
02374 ##
02375 # dropped_ancestral_inbreeding() uses a gene dropping approach to calculate
02376 # ancestral inbreeding, the probability of an individual inheriting an allele
02377 # that has undergone inbreeding in the past at least once.
02378 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
02379 # @param rounds The number of times to simulate segregation through the entire pedigree.
02380 # @param loci The number biallelic, unlinked loci to simulate.
02381 # @param frequency The minor allele frequency.
02382 # @param seed The seed for the RNG.
02383 # @retval A dictionary of ancestral inbreeding coefficients keyed to animal IDs.
02384 def dropped_ancestral_inbreeding(pedobj, rounds=100, loci=100, frequency=0.05, seed=5048665):
02385     """
02386     dropped_ancestral_inbreeding() uses a gene dropping approach to calculate
02387     ancestral inbreeding, the probability of an individual inheriting an allele
02388     that has undergone inbreeding in the past at least once.
02389     """
02390     try: logging.info('Entered dropped_ancestral_inbreeding()')
02391     except: pass
02392     if rounds < 1:
02393         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02394             print '[ERROR]: The rounds parameter in pyp_metrics/dropped_ancestral_inbreeding() must be positive (>0)! Defaulting to 100.'
02395         rounds = 100
02396     if loci < 1:
02397         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02398             print '[ERROR]: The loci parameter in pyp_metrics/dropped_ancestral_inbreeding() must be positive (>0)! Defaulting to 100.'
02399         rounds = 100
02400     if frequency < 0.:
02401         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02402             print '[ERROR]: The frequency parameter in pyp_metrics/dropped_ancestral_inbreeding() must be positive (>0)! Defaulting to 0.01.'
02403         frequency = 0.01
02404     if frequency > 1.:
02405         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02406             print '[ERROR]: The frequency parameter in pyp_metrics/dropped_ancestral_inbreeding() cannot be >1! Defaulting to 0.01.'
02407         frequency = 0.01
02408     try:
02409         _seed = int(seed)
02410     except:
02411         if pedobj.kw['debug_messages']:
02412             print '[ERROR]: The seed parameter in pyp_metrics/dropped_ancestral_inbreeding() must be an integer! Defaulting to 5048665.'
02413         seed = 5048665
02414     # Build a list of generations
02415     l = len(pedobj.pedigree)
02416     # Build a list of unique generations so that we can find the most recent generation
02417     gens = []       # list of generation IDs in the pedigree
02418     ngen = 0    # Number of animals in the latest generation
02419     nfounders = 0
02420     n_g = 0.0   # Effective number of founder genomes
02421     for j in range(l):
02422         g = pedobj.pedigree[j].gen
02423         if g in gens:
02424             pass
02425         else:
02426             gens.append(g)
02427         if pedobj.pedigree[j].founder == 'y':
02428             nfounders = nfounders + 1
02429     gens.sort()
02430     allele_dict = {}
02431     summary_freqs = {}
02432     id2aic = {}     # Map animal IDs to ancestral ID coefficients
02433     summary_freqs['distinct_alleles'] = {}
02434     summary_stats = {}
02435     summary_stats['distinct_alleles'] = {}
02436     outputfile = '%s%s%s' % (pedobj.kw['filetag'],'_gene_drop','.out')
02437     myline = '='*80
02438     myline2 = '*'*80
02439     numpy.random.seed(seed)
02440     for r in range(rounds):
02441         allele_inbred = {}
02442         # The dictionary ancestor_alleles contains alleles for
02443         # eah locus in the simulaton.
02444         for p in pedobj.pedigree:
02445             p.ancestor_alleles = {}
02446             # Create a new set of alleles to drop for each round.
02447             for lo in xrange(loci):
02448                 p.ancestor_alleles[lo] = []
02449                 # Founders contribute two novel alleles
02450                 if p.founder == 'y':
02451                     _allele_1 = '%s_%s_1' % (p.paddedID,lo+1)
02452                     _allele_2 = '%s_%s_2' % (p.paddedID,lo+1)
02453                 # Half-founders contribute one novel allele
02454                 elif str(p.sireID) == str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']):
02455                     _allele_1 = '%s_%s_1' % (p.paddedID,lo+1)
02456                     _allele_2 = ''
02457                 elif str(p.damID) == str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']):
02458                     _allele_1 = ''
02459                     _allele_2 = '%s_%s_1' % (p.paddedID,lo+1)
02460                 else:
02461                     _allele_1 = ''
02462                     _allele_2 = ''
02463                 p.ancestor_alleles[lo].append(_allele_1)
02464                 p.ancestor_alleles[lo].append(_allele_2)
02465                 allele_dict[lo] = {}
02466             allele_inbred[p.animalID] = numpy.zeros([loci],'d')
02467             id2aic[p.animalID] = 0.
02468         # Now that we have the ancestor loci populated we can start
02469         # the gene dropping
02470         for lo in xrange(loci):
02471             for i in range(l):
02472                 if pedobj.pedigree[i].founder == 'y':
02473                     pass
02474                 else:
02475                     # Pick a sire allele at random
02476                     if numpy.random.ranf() < frequency:
02477                         _as = pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID)-1].ancestor_alleles[lo][0]
02478                     else:
02479                         _as = pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID)-1].ancestor_alleles[lo][1]
02480                     # Pick a dam allele at random
02481                     if numpy.random.ranf() < frequency:
02482                         _ad = pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].damID)-1].ancestor_alleles[lo][0]
02483                     else:
02484                         _ad = pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].damID)-1].ancestor_alleles[lo][1]
02485                     # This looks funny, right? The whole idea here is that we're looking for
02486                     # inbreeding which occured BEFORE a pair of alleles arrived in this animal,
02487                     # so we've got to look back and see if the alleles were IBD in the parent.
02488                     pedobj.pedigree[i].ancestor_alleles[lo] = [_as,_ad]
02489                     if pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID)-1].ancestor_alleles[lo][0] == \
02490                         pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].sireID)-1].ancestor_alleles[lo][1]:
02491                         allele_inbred[pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID][lo] = 1.
02492                     if pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].damID)-1].ancestor_alleles[lo][0] == \
02493                         pedobj.pedigree[int(pedobj.pedigree[i].damID)-1].ancestor_alleles[lo][1]:
02494                         allele_inbred[pedobj.pedigree[i].animalID][lo] = 1.
02495         # Sumamarize allele data
02496         for p in pedobj.pedigree:
02497             id2aic[p.animalID] = id2aic[p.animalID] + allele_inbred[p.animalID].mean()
02498     try: logging.info('Exited dropped_ancestral_inbreeding()')
02499     except: pass
02500     return id2aic
02501 
02502 ##
02503 # ballou_ancestral_inbreeding() calculates ancestral inbreeding,
02504 # the probability of an individual inheriting an allele that has
02505 # undergone inbreeding in the past at least once, using the method
02506 # of Ballou (1997).
02507 # @param pedobj A PyPedal pedigree object.
02508 # @retval A dictionary of ancestral inbreeding coefficients keyed to animal IDs.
02509 def ballou_ancestral_inbreeding(pedobj):
02510     """
02511     ballou_ancestral_inbreeding() calculates ancestral inbreeding,
02512     the probability of an individual inheriting an allele that has
02513     undergone inbreeding in the past at least once, using the method
02514     of Ballou (1997).
02515     """
02516     try: logging.info('Entered ballou_ancestral_inbreeding()')
02517     except: pass
02518     # Initialize the dictionary mapping animal IDs to ancestor inbreeding.
02519     id2aic = {}
02520     for p in pedobj.pedigree:
02521         id2aic[p.animalID] = 0.
02522     # Calculate coefficients of inbreeding if they're not already in the pedigree.
02523     if not pedobj.kw['f_computed']:
02524         pyp_nrm.inbreeding(pedobj)
02525     # Calculate ancestral inbreeding
02526     for p in pedobj.pedigree:
02527         if str(p.sireID) == str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']):
02528             f_s = 0.
02529             f_as = 0.
02530         else:
02531             f_s = pedobj.pedigree[p.sireID-1].fa
02532             f_as = id2aic[p.sireID]
02533         if str(p.damID) == str(pedobj.kw['missing_parent']):
02534             f_d = 0.
02535             f_ad = 0.
02536         else:
02537             f_d = pedobj.pedigree[p.damID-1].fa
02538             f_ad = id2aic[p.damID]
02539         id2aic[p.animalID] = ( f_as + (1.-f_as)*f_s + \
02540             f_ad + (1.-f_ad) * f_d ) / 2.
02541     try: logging.info('Exited ballou_ancestral_inbreeding()')
02542     except: pass
02543     return id2aic
